loans.name: Felicindo

texts.es:
Felicindo tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el Caserío Laynas, una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura , ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de ganado caprino, desde varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Felicindo is 48 years old. He lives in the small village of Laynas, a rural area in the La Matanza district that is located in the Morropon province, which belongs to the Piura region in the northern coast of Peru. It is a place where the population primarily works in agriculture, livestock, and commerce and has basic services such as water and electricity.

For several years he has made a living selling goats. His business is located in the back of his house. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed for the fattening of his goats and, in this way, earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for the fattening of his goats.

loans.name: Lean's Group

texts.en: Lean, age 53, is residing in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province.  She has 10 children, 2 of whom remain in school. To make a living, she does rice and cassava farming plus working for others for a fee during her spare time to earn more income. She has been involved with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a long time. Lean has repaid her past loan with success and she has been able to stabilize her living conditions progressively. For this cycle, she leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for land plowing. She hopes that with the help of loan she will be able to get a higher yield from both of her farms.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for land plowing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Genie

texts.en: Genie is 51 years old, married and lives at Cataggaman Viejo. Her spouse is a tricycle driver while she is a vendor selling books and textbooks to schools and small bookshops. She has been in her business for over five years now. She also tried selling foods for snacks but she stopped that due to slow income from it and decided to focus on her book-selling business. She is now asking for additional capital of P 40,000 to buy more books (encyclopedias, textbooks) to sell. She hopes to keep maintaining a good flow of income and to achieve financial stability for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more books (encyclopedias, textbooks) to sell to schools and small bookshops

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres, hermano y sobrina. Manuel es un hombre trabajador quien trabaja en un restaurante y además en su lugar de habitación posee una tienda la cual le permite ajustar los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades del hogar. Él es un hombre muy visionario quien con el deseo de superarse y dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI  para invertir en su negocio dado que desea cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus ventas e ingresos. Con el crédito comprará: cereales, golosinas, aceite, café, detergentes, bebidas gaseosas, etc.
texts.en:
Manuel is 32 years old. He lives in his own home, along with his parents, brother, and niece. Manuel is a hardworking man who works in a restaurant. He also has a store in his home that allows him to supplement his income to cover the costs of the household.

He is a visionary man. With the hope of improving himself and giving his family better living conditions, he decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in his business. He wants to meet an increased demand that will allow him to increase his sales and income. With the loan he will buy: cereal, sweets, oil, coffee, detergent, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy cereal, candy, oil, coffee, detergent, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Al Dakwa Group

texts.en:
Hanan is the featured borrower of Al Dakwa group.  She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been best friends and seek to develop their families' living situation.

Hanan is a 45-year-old married mother of four who, one year ago, started her own Mouneh  production and sales business (Conserved food Industry) to help her beloved husband in covering their family's needs and living expenses. Their combined incomes aren't enough to cover quite all of their children's needs, and for this reason she is working hard to develop her activity through increasing her business production and income.

Hanan is a hard-working woman, with an excellent reputation in her region. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her daughter's college tuition fees. She hopes that she can develop her business and move it outside her house to attract more customers in order to stay capable of providing more education levels to her children.

Hanan is the first lady sitting at the far left in the picture. As for the other members, Souad is the lady at the center, and Zahra is the lady sitting on the far right side.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's college tuition fees

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio has six children and is happily married. Five of his children have already finished their education and have jobs now while the youngest is still attending school to finish his college level of education. Rogelio wishes that all his children would prosper in their life. He is doing his best to give the best way of living to them. He doesn’t want them to experience the difficulties that he had. Rogelio is a farmer who grows rice in his field. He doesn’t want to waste his efforts in raising his crops. That’s why, rain or shine, Rogelio always visits his farm just to ensure that his crops are in good condition. Rogelio wishes for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides. He hopes to attain his wish someday, and succeed with his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products for her grocery store

loans.name: Channer's Group

texts.en:
Channer, 28, lives with her husband and four children in a village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing various kinds of vegetables for almost ten years and they supplement the family’s income by raising cows. She can earn about 80,000 KHR per day. 

Channer has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles and completely repaid the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
At the age of 25, Memory is a successful entrepreneur who sells clothing at the local flea market in Gokwe South, Zimbabwe. She sells items such as dresses, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts. As a mother of one, she works hard to ensure that she can break the cycle of poverty by providing for her family financially. She has been running this business for half a year now and it has helped her support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Memory will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her inventory. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

To give back to her community, Memory volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools. She is also an inspiration to many young ladies as she is always motivating and encouraging other young women to be economically independent.

loans.use: to purchase more bags and clothing

loans.name: Chorm's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Chorm is 57 years old and married. She and her husband have six children. To make a living, she has been growing cassava and working for others for a fee. 

This is the second loan for Chorm with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three females to seek a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to raise more crops and sell them for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en:
Savoeun is a resident of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 39 years old and married with four children. All of her children are living and dependent on her and three of them are going to school. She earns a living from rice farming which she has been doing for about 21 years already. 

This is the third loan for Savoeun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely and they have enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle gradually. In a group of two, she is the leader.  She and her joint borrower are requesting a loan of 2,800,000 KHR which makes an equal share of 1,400,000 KHR each. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pay the land plowing fee. She hopes that the loan will enable her to uplift the living conditions of her family at a gradual pace.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay land plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Bovel district, Sopheak is a 32-year-old father of two children. The main source of his family’s income is from rice farming, which he has been in for 15 years. With his current business, he can earn about KHR 70,000 per day to spend on daily expenses. 

This is the seventh loan for Sopheak with VisionFund. He successfully paid back the prior loans with VisionFund. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan. He will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his income so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a micro-entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Coron is one of the tourist spots in the Philippines because of its beautiful beaches and it is also one of the places that was hit by typhoon Haiyan last November 2013. Salvacion is married to Teotimo, a tricycle driver and they have four children. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Salvacion operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to pay for recyclable materials from collectors. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. 

Salvacion dreams to have other sources of income and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials from collectors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Enia

texts.en: Enia is a 23-year-old businesswoman living in Gokwe North, a district in northern Zimbabwe near the border of Zambia, with her three siblings. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for over a year. She sells various grocery items. She also volunteers as a janitor cleaning toilets at the local secondary and primary schools in her community. With the requested Kiva loan, Enia intends to purchase more sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks to improve sales and profits. She hopes to be able to provide for her siblings.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chicks, feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 23 years old. She lives with her husband and one child in Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. Since Rosemary cares deeply about those in her community, she volunteers her time teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. 

Rosemary also rents a stall at the local flea market where she sells products such as jean trousers, formal trousers, tracksuits, shoes, ladies' tops, dresses, shorts and other clothing items. She has been running this business for more than one year now and it has enabled her to support her family. With the Kiva loan, Rosemary will purchase more items of clothing to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring financial stability to her life and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nerry

texts.en:
Nerry is married with 3 children. She is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.                           

Nerry is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She requested a loan to pay for 6 sacks of fertilizer.                                                                          

Nerry has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Nerry hopes to harvest more even more corn.

loans.use: to pay for 6 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He used his previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He has been an artist and has been working for six years. His love for art inspired him to follow this career path and his dream is to further his studies in order to open an art gallery. For this reason he is requesting a loan to pay his tuition for a master's level course. He is still has limited income but he hopes to educate his entire family.

loans.use: to pay his tuition for a master's course.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married with 5 children. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines.                             

Elsa is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan to pay for pesticide and 10 sacks of fertilizer.                                                           

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Elsa hopes to harvest even more rice.

loans.use: to pay for pesticide and 10 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is married with 3 children. She is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.                       

Marissa is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan to pay for 10 sacks of fertilizer.                                                                         

Marissa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Marissa hopes to buy truck to transport her crop.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is a 22-year-old entrepreneur living in Gokwe South, Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling grocery products for 8 months now out of her home. She also volunteers as a learner guide and a community health activist in her district. 

Blessing sees the Kiva loan as an opportunity to grow her business and increase her standard of living. With the requested loan, Blessing will make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, soap and salt. With the additional profits she hopes to open a shop at the local business center and create jobs in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of grocery products.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold, a father of two children, provides transportation services in his village to make a living. For more than a year, he has earned well to provide for the family. He borrowed a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for his transportation services business. With the microfinance loan from GDMPC, his plan was realized. 

In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Tafadzwa

texts.en:
At the young age of 20, Tafadzwa is already an entrepreneur running a successful grocery business selling flour, sugar, salt, and candles to her community members in Gokwe North, Zimbabwe. 

For the past year, she has built up a reliable client base who likes going to her shop because of the fair prices she charges. Tafadzwa also has a strong desire to give back to her community, and she volunteers as a life skills educator at her former school. 

With the requested loan from Kiva, Tafadzwa will purchase inventory for her shop. She hopes to expand and be able to provide for her family. Her greatest hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Jairo De Jesus

texts.es:
Jairo ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida en el campo trabajando y rebuscándose para poder sobrevivir, creció en el seno humilde de una familia trabajadora y laboriosa.
Hoy en día se dedica a las labores agrícolas a una escala pequeña y tiene como objetivo tener un terreno más grande para cosechar hortalizas como papa y frijol.
Actualmente vende sus productos en la plaza de mercado de la región, pero sueña con poder vender grandes cantidades de alimentos a las grandes productoras y distribuidoras.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas y abonos, elementos que le permitirán tener su pequeña tierra en perfectas condiciones para sus cultivos y así, poco a poco poder cumplir con su seño.
texts.en:
Jairo has spent most of his life working the field and making an effort to get by. He grew up in a hardworking and humble family.

Nowadays he dedicates to small-scale agricultural activities. His objective is to have a bigger land to harvest vegetables, like potatoes, and beans.

Currently, he sales his products at the square of the local market, but he dreams about selling greater quantities of food to the big producers and distributors. 

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and manure. These are products that will allow him to maintain his land in perfect conditions for his crops, and fulfill his dream little by little.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan- this time for PHP 17,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maria hopes to increase her profit as she makes improvements to her storehouse. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
Amalia, anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio de mariscos, y cambio de actividad por el cansancio que ocasionaba el viajar a las comunidades a comprar el marisco para luego llevarlo a Ibarra para su venta en el mercado.
Hoy Amalia tiene 42 años de edad. Y desde hace 2 años tiene una tienda en San Lorenzo, donde le va muy bien por que goza de buena clientela y a pesar que su tienda no es muy grande. Ella la mantiene bien surtida con una variedad de productos de consumo masivo.
Tiene 3 hijos. El mayor ya tiene su propio compromiso y los otros 2 asisten regularmente a clases.
Menciona conocerse desde hace varios años con sus compañeros de grupo, quienes han mostrado un alto grado de responsabilidad en los pagos del crédito. Ella se apoya con FODEMI desde hace 4 años y espera crecer en este negocio para continuar brindando el apoyo en educación a sus hijos.
En esta ocasión Amalia recibirá $750 dólares; con los que comprará una refrigeradora para conservar por más tiempo embutidos, quesos, carnes, gaseosas y jugos naturales.
A demás desea implementar un pequeño bazar con material escolar que es lo que buscan mucho los estudiantes.
de esta forma brindara a sus comunidad mas productos y bien conservados.
Amalia. Extiende el agradecimiento a esta institución por que brinda la oportunidad de transformar la vida de las personas en especial de los niños en los lugares más necesitados y apartados.
texts.en:
Amalia previously made her living selling shellfish.  She changed jobs because of the fatigue caused by traveling to the communities where she would buy the shellfish and then bringing it to Ibarra to sell in the market. 
Amalia is now 42-years old.  For the last two years, she has run a store in San Lorenzo,  The store is doing very well and Amalia is enjoying a large clientele in spite of not having a very large store.  She keeps the store well-stocked with a variety of consumer goods. 
Amalia has three children.  Her eldest has his own commitments, and the other two attend school regularly. 
Amalia says that she's known the other members of her communal bank for a number a years.  They have all shown a high level of responsibility in repaying their loans.  She, herself, has been a part of FODEMI for four years.  She hopes to grow in her business so she can keep offering her children an education. 
At this time, Amalia will receive $750.  She will use the loan to purchase a refrigerator to preserve her store's cold cuts, cheeses, meats, sodas and natural juices for a longer period of time.
In addition, she wants to open a small dollar store to sell school supplies, as that is what the students are always looking for.  This is a way she can offer her community more and better preserved products. 
Amalia extends her gratitude to the institution for offering people in the neediest and most isolated places the opportunity to transform their lives, especially the children.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to preserve her store's products and to open a small dollar store to sell school supplies, which is what the students are always looking for.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 34 years old, married, and has three children attending school.  Her husband is a farmer who plants and harvests corn on their field.  Sometimes, when her husband has spare time, usually after the harvest season, he operates a tricycle for passenger transportation.  

Editha wants to help her husband, even if only in a simple way.  She decided to continue her direct sales business that she started when she was still single.  Editha is selling a variety of ready-to-wear apparels and cosmetics products.  She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy shirts, shoes, underwear, and cosmetics items.  She believes that by procuring the loan, she would buy and deliver her costumer's orders on time.  Editha is doing her best to improve her direct sales business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shoes, underwear, and cosmetics items.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Norma tiene 40 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, actualmente ella es madre soltera de dos hijos pues su pareja la abandonó, de los cuales solo la hija menor estudia y el hijo mayor trabaja, nadie mas mas vive con ellos en casa.

Norma se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos durante toda su vida, trabaja limpiando casas, para llegar al lugar de trabajo se transporta en bus y hace un recorrido de 45 metros, y su horario de trabajo es de 7:30 AM a 4:30 PM.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar un motor para el pozo ya que la profundidad es considerable y se le dificulta sacar el agua con lazo y cubetas. 

Sus sueños a futuro son seguir trabajando par mantener a sus hijos y que el menor termine sus estudios y verlo graduarse.
texts.en: Norma is 40 years old. She studied through the third grade. Currently, she is a single mother with two children since her husband left her. Of her two children, only her younger daughter is in school. Her older son works. No one else lives with them in their house. Norma has been a domestic worker for her entire life. She works cleaning houses. In order to go to work, she takes and bus and walks 45 meters. Her work schedule in from 7:30 AM - 4:30 PM. She needs the loan to buy a motor for her well since it is very deep and it is difficult to collect water using a rope and buckets. Her dreams for the future are to continue working to support her children so the younger one can finish studying and graduate.

loans.use: to buy a motor for her well since it is very deep and it is difficult to collect water using a rope and buckets.

loans.name: Viito

texts.en:
Viito is a married man, aged 41 years.  He is an old client who has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy cattle for his business.  He trades cattle from a local area in Kimuri Parish, Igara, in the Bushenyi district of Uganda.  

He started his business in the year 2000 with the aim of earning income to sustain himself, but that has now grown.  He also sells tea from his plantation to increase his monthly income.  Vito is a hardworking man who works 8 hours a day and 5 days a week.  Vito's customers are cattle traders. He is faced with the challenge of competition but is ready to compete with others through his hard work. 

He hopes to boost his business, become financially stable, and educate all his children so they may attain a better future.

loans.use: to buy cows for trade.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 37-year-old married mother of four whose husband works in construction.  She recently opened her own undergarment and shoe store in 2012 to support her family.  Fadwa faced some trouble overcoming the financial uncertainty she experienced at the early stages of her business.  Now that her shop has taken off, she dedicates all the success she’s earned so far to her hard work and persistence. 

Fadwa’s optimism led her to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, in order to expand her business for the summer season, through increasing her business merchandise with a special release summer collection.  She knows that with a diverse inventory, she can hopefully attract a wide variety of customers to her shop.  

In the future, she hopes to continue growing her business and seek further financial stability.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a summer collection.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene tres hijos que viven en casa y estudian. 

Han transcurrido 23 años desde que Miguel se dedica a la albañilería y lo aprendió ya que desde chico le ayudaba a un señor como mozo, actualmente es contratista de maestro de obra, el lugar donde trabaja le  queda a 20 metros de su casa y se va en carro, el horario es de 7:30 AM a 5:00 PM. 

El crédito lo necesita para instalar energía eléctrica en su casa, mejorará sus condiciones de vida ya que por las noches se sentirá mas seguro y podrá tener los beneficios de utilizar energía eléctrica. 

Sus sueños a futuro son que sus hijos sean profesionales y siempre tener trabajo para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Miguel is 39 years old. He studied through the third grade. He is married and his wife is a housewife. He has three children who live at home and go to school. Miguel has been a mason for 23 years. He learned the trade as a child working as an apprentice. Currently, he works as a master craftsman. He works 20 meters from his house and he goes by car. He works from 7:30 AM-5:00 PM. He needs to loan to install electricity in his house. It will improve his living conditions since he will feel safer at night and he will benefit by using electricity. He dreams that his children will become professionals and always have work to support their families.

loans.use: to install electricity in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and fish.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is 42 years old and married with eight children, seven of whom go to school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Ezra sells coffee in a rural area and earns a monthly salary as additional income. Ezra began the coffee business to have income for the family. Ezra faces a difficulty of inadequate capital. Hence, he is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children. He has a dream of looking after his family and children to a level of self-dependency.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with one child. She is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines.                             

Delia is a farmer and grows palay to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan to pay for chemicals and 10 sacks of fertilizer.                                                           

Delia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to harvest more palay crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kimratvannak

texts.en:
Kimratvannak, twenty years old, is single and lives with his parents and sisters in a suburb of Phnom Penh. His parents sell noodles with soup.

Kimratvannak is now a first-year student at Phnom Penh University, majoring in Electrical Engineering. He hopes to graduate with a degree that will get him into a professional position. He is applying for a 250 USD loan through MAXIMA to pay his tuition.

loans.use: to pay his tuition.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is married with three children. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines.                             

Emeliana is a farmer and grows palay to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan to pay for chemicals and 10 sacks of fertilizer.                                                           

Emeliana has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Emeliana hopes to harvest more palay crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Edgar Hilario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Edgar Hilario se dedica al negocio de ganaderia,el socio tambien se dedica al negocio de agricultura,el socio tiene un terreno donde cultiva cafe y cacao,el socio los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados.El socio solicita el credito para comprar ganados.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edgar Hilario belongs to the communal bank "KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANITOIGI." The bank is located in the district of Echarate, La Convención Province, Department of Cusco.

Edgar Hilario makes a living in the cattle business, and he also works in agriculture. Edgar has land where he grows coffee and cocoa. He raises and fattens the cattle and then sells them in different markets. Edgar works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., and through this work he wants to get ahead. Edgar's dream is to broaden his cattle sales business. Edgar is requesting this loan to buy cattle.

Edgar is happy to receive this loan and commits to make all the required payments.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Luceritos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCERITOS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompa y mantas, venta de papas fritas, venta de peluches, venta de comida, venta de frutas, venta de colorantes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rita es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años al aprender de su amiga la técnica de tejido decide implementar este conocimiento con fuente de generación económica. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, los ahorros y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Luceritos” (Little Bright Stars) is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Rita is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as weaving sweaters and blankets, selling potato chips, selling plush toys, selling food, selling fruit, and selling dyes.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Rita. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization. Rita currently has a business where she weaves and sells blankets. She gained knowledge about this type of work several years ago when she started her business. Rita learned her weaving techniques from a friend and decided to channel this knowledge into a source of income generation.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool in bulk. She acquires her supplies at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then sells her products according to her customers’ requests. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family. Rita is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rita said that she enjoys the health services, the savings, and the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married with six children. She is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines.                             

Cristina is a farmer and grows palay crop to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan to pay for chemicals and 10 sacks of fertilizer.                                                           

Cristina has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for six years. In the future, Cristina hopes to harvest more palay crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Saliima

texts.en:
Saliima, 24, is single with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. For the past three years she has operated a mobile money outlet. (A mobile money business involves receiving and sending money to one another using mobile phones.) She also owns a salon for ladies as an additional source of income.

Saliima is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan to invest in her mobile money business to meet the increased demands of her customers. She is hardworking and hopes to increase her capital both for her business and for future needs.

loans.use: to invest in her mobile money business

loans.name: Satine

texts.en:
Satine lives in Kapan town with her husband and three-year-old son. Her husband is involved in a transportation business. Specifically, using his own truck, he transports products to the regional open markets. 

To take care of the family's needs, Satine, with the help of her husband, is engaged in breeding pigs and in aviculture. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way and to develop it further, Satine needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase five calves and wheat as forage for the livestock and renovate the barn. Satine and her husband rely highly on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for five calves and forage and renovate the barn

loans.name: Pisey's Group

texts.en:
Pisey, 32, lives in a rural area of the Bovel district of Battambang province and she is married with three children. The family’s main sources of income are from planting cassava and farming rice in the local village. She has been in this business for five years. She is able to earn about 60,000 KHR per day.

Pisey has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her relieve her family's burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor and land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to make more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Elvis Jose

texts.es: Elvis es de profesión administrador de empresas, pero labora como vendedor de repuestos de vehículo, siendo un gran logro para el contar con un empleo fijo, es padre soltero con un hijo de 4 años por el que trabaja para brindarle sus estudios y las condiciones básicas para su buen crecimiento. Elvis continua con la etapa de mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda, en esta ocasión necesita el crédito para comprar materiales y terminar de realizar el muro perimetral de su vivienda el cual ha dejado inconcluso.
texts.en:
Elvis is a business manager by profession. His work involves selling vehicle parts. He feels that it is a great achievement to have a steady job. Elvis is a single father with a four-year-old son. For this reason, he works in order to provide for his education and basic conditions that promote good growth.

Elvis continues to take steps toward improving his conditions at home. On this occasion, he needs a loan so that he can buy materials in order to complete the construction of a security wall around his home that was left unfinished.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a security wall.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has been operating his own “sari-sari” (variety) store for fifteen years and he earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for his three children. Samson and his wife had to work hard, with determination to have a better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Samson would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of PHP 24,000, he could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business. He sincerely lets you know his heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Samson wants to open branches for his variety store. He also hopes to see improvement in his life, in his wife's, and in his children's.

He meets up every week with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which he studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 35 years old. He is married with six children who are 12, 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years old. Five of his children attend school at the moment. He does coffee trading as his business, which he started in 2009 to have a source of income in his family. He has applied for a loan of 800,000 shillings to buy improved coffee seeds for planting so that he can improve his yields and therefore, boost the business. The business is done in a bit of a rural setting in Kakanju, Igara, Bushenyi district and his clients are his fellow coffee traders and factory business people. He is a hardworking man who works 8 hours a day and 6 days a week to maximize returns. He is faced with the challenge of competition from other business people but is ready to achieve his dreams through his hard work. He hopes to boost his business and become financially stable with continuous financial support from UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy coffee seeds

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Rith, 24, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Memot district and is a married mother of one daughter. She has farmed cassava for five years, earning about 26,000 KHR per day. From this she manages to save about 15,000 KHR for future needs.

Rith has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and successfully repaid her loan. With the loan she was able to better support her family and maintain their living conditions.

Now applying for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR through VisionFund Cambodia, she is going to buy fertilizer and seeds for her field. She hopes to expand her farm so as to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her field

loans.name: Roen

texts.en:
Roen, 45, is married with five children and resides in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Cambodia. One of her five children is in school. For the last 25 years, she has been raising pigs and growing cassava. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day.

Roen has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her plantation. She hopes to grow her cassava quickly so as to make more crops.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a Ugandan married honest man. He is 34 years old with three children, and all attend school in Kagadi. He has been operating a hotel for 12 years and teaches to supplement his income. He hopes to generate more income despite the time limits. Nelson is requesting for a loan to construct a commercial house.

loans.use: to construct a commercial house

loans.name: Claribel Arely

texts.es:
Claribel, de 28 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.
Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros.
Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.
Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.
Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Claribel, age 28, is very clear about what she wants for her life. She decided to finish her studies so that she can move forward and have a good life.

Claribel works as a salesperson. She sells various merchandise such as clothing, accessories that include wallets, a few cosmetics, and other products. Claribel started this business because she wanted to have the necessary resources for supporting herself and paying for her studies. She is an enterprising and highly disciplined woman.

Claribel is requesting a loan in order to buy an ample stock of merchandise so that she can have available inventory to sell to her customers. She is hopeful about making progress as a businesswoman and having a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise in order to restock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Enkhjargal is 26 years old and lives with her husband, two children and mother in law in Ulaanbaatar, which is the capital city of Mongolia. She has her own section at the local mall and sells children's clothes. Her husband works in Korea and is currently on vacation and came home. They inherited their house from her husband's brother which was built in 2000. Now she is requesting loan of 3,000 USD to fix the roof, do the insulation and make other necessary repairs. If she repairs the house, her family will stay in the warmth and comfort during Mongolia's harsh winter. Moreover, they would use less coal, which pollutes the air and is becoming a big problem in Mongolia.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa de 49 años de edad, no estudió, ahora está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al trabajo en la agricultura y además a reventar piedras con dinamita, tiene dos hijos pero ya no viven en casa.

Josefa toda su vida de ha dedicado a los trabajos en la agricultura, la actividad la aprendió de su familia y su esposo también se dedica a lo mismo, para llegar al lugar donde ellos cultivan tardan aproximadamente 20 minutos y se van a pie.

El crédito será utilizado para cancelar el alquiler de la tierra donde cultiva, para comprar herbicidas y fertilizantes que les permitirán obtener una buena cosecha y así tener seguridad alimenticia y económica.

Su plan principal es que Dios les brinde salud para seguir trabajando y obtener una buena cosecha para hacer frente a sus responsabilidades adquiridas todo esto ellos saben que requiere mucho trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Josefa is 49 years old and did not receive an education. She is currently in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture. In addition, they blast stones with the use of dynamite. Josefa has two children, but they no longer live at home.

Her entire life has been devoted to farm work, a trade that she learned from her family. Her husband is also in the same line of work. In order to reach the place where she cultivates her crops, she must travel approximately 20 minutes by foot.

Josefa’s loan will be used to pay the rent on the land that she cultivates. She will also buy herbicides and fertilizers so that she can achieve a good harvest. This will provide her with a steady food supply and income.

Her main plan is for God to keep her healthy so that she can continue working, but also to obtain a good harvest so that she can fulfill her responsibilities. To achieve all of these goals, she knows that it will require a great amount of work and effort.

loans.use: to pay the rent on her farm land and to buy herbicides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: Rashad is a taxi driver. He is 30 years old, married and a father of two children. Rashad is an IDP, and now he lives in the Absheron region with his lovely family. Today, the tires of his car are outdated and Rashad wants to change them. For that he needs a loan in amount of 600 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN) for repair. Rashad says he is very thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help.

loans.use: to pay for a change of tires for his car.

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSITAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de queso, venta de leche, servicio de construcción, venta de fibra de alpaca, agricultura.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus compañeras que ya pertenecían a la Banca Comunal. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de queso y venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar y que al empezar a convivir con su pareja deciden seguir realizando el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra forraje para ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo dará a su ganado para la crianza. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Rositas” (The Little Roses) is starting its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Julia is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling food, selling cheese, selling milk, providing construction services, selling alpaca wool, and farming.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Julia. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from her fellow group members who are part of the Communal Bank. Julia currently has a business where she produces cheese and sells milk. She became knowledgeable about this type of work since she was part of a family business. When she began living with her partner, Julia decided to continue in the same business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to buy fodder for her cows during times of drought. She will acquire the feed from wholesale vendors in her community and provide it to her cows so that they can grow. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family. Julia is in a common-law relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Julia said that she enjoys the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is a 41-year-old female who is married with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is a cashier who works eight hours a day and has been in service for four years. Jesca loved counting money. That’s what inspired her to join the profession. Jesca wishes her children to have an improved standard of living, which is why she is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children. Jesca is hardworking and hopes to achieve her dream in regards to her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 48 years old, married and has four children. 

She has been managing a store for five years now as her source of her income. She offers grocery items to the people in her village and gives a friendly service. Margie wants to increase the volume of sales in her business but she needs additional capital to buy more items to sell. Therefore she is now asking for PHP 5,000 to buy sardines, noodles, biscuits and soap to sell. 

She promises to pay back her loan in full and keep achieving good sales for her family.

loans.use: to buy sardines, noodles, biscuits and soap to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time PHP 40,000. Eva will be using the loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Eva dreams of succeeding in all that she is pursuing in life. She hopes to give her family a bright and better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Romela works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Romela is borrowing PHP 60,000 through NWTF to buy additional new fishing nets for her fishing business.

Romela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional new fishing nets

loans.name: Phyna

texts.en:
Phyna is aged 30 and married with three dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province in the Kampong Siem district, and she earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava and beans. Together with her husband she can earn about KHR 28,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 15,000 each day for their future needs.

This is Phyna's first microloan with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her plantation, and she will use a portion of it to spend on labor. 

She hopes to grow more rice and sell it for a good price in order to to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Saem, 58, has five children in total. Saem and her husband are farmers who have been farming rice and growing cassava for 38 years to make a living.
 
Saem has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her to improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. 

Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice well and to increase the yield so that she can improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn owns and operates a farm where she plants and harvests coconuts to sell. She's been in this business for ten years and it sustains a living. She personally manages the farm while her husband works abroad.

Recently she has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase organic fertilizer in order to gain more return for the family.

She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to continue to improve and cultivate her farm.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Chiedza

texts.en: As a mother of two, 26-year-old Chiedza is very dedicated to successfully running her grocery and hardware business in Zimbabwe’s Gokwe North District. She sells basic groceries such as flour, rice, and sugar as well as wrist watches, locks and glue in the hardware corner. Chiedza volunteers as a Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she guides students in a course that focuses on improving their wellbeing and life skills. With the requested loan form Kiva, Chiedza will purchase more merchandise for her shop. She hopes to always be able to provide for her two children.

loans.use: To purchase more food products and hardware items to sell in her general/hardware store

loans.name: Rerb's Group

texts.en:
Rerb is 34 and lives with her husband and three children in a village in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 14 years. The current business earns her about 18,000 KHR per day.
Rerb has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle and completely paid back the loan. With the loan from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Phoeung

texts.en: Phoeung is 52 years old. She is a married woman with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a cloth weaver and her husband is a construction worker. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $700 to purchase cows to breed and to resell. This loan will help her make more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase cows to breed and to resell

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: Sarin is 41 years old and a mother of three children. She lives in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Her entire income comes from rice and cassava farming that she has been involved in for 21 years. In this business, she earns about 31,400 KHR per day. Now, Sarin leads this group of four to request a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and they are in their first loan cycle. She and her joint borrowers are requesting a loan for the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for fertilizer and cassava seedling purchasing. She hopes to have a large harvest and make more profit than before.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and cassava seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy haberdashery items

loans.name: Ron's Group

texts.en: Ron is a mother of two little kids and local villager from Bovel district of Battambang province. Rice farming on one hectare of farmland is the main source for her to earn income and a paid job for supplementing her income. She has engaged with this business for five years with 21,900 KHR in return. She is a the first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader for the loan. She and her joint-borrower are requesting loans for the same amount, i.e., 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan to pay for plowing, labor fees and for purchasing seed. She hopes to increase her income and to improve her living situation over what she now has.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, labor fees and for rice seed

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en: Mr. Batchuluun is 54 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2007. His wife has retired from work and receives a small state pension. All their children, except the youngest son, are employed and contribute to the family income. Four years have passed since he used his previous loan for a heating system for his house. The house his family lives in now needs some repairs. So he is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to buy building material such as planks, cement and bricks for house renovation and to build a garden. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal needs to be burned and less pollutants will be released into air. Also he will plant trees in his new garden in order to create a comfortable environment.

loans.use: to renovate his house and build a garden

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 44 years old, married and an industrious mother of four. She is a vendor of rice and to increase her income she also sells beauty soap such as papaya soap. She offers this soap to her neighbors and customers from her rice retailing business. She is now asking for PHP 5,000 to buy more papaya soap to sell and rice to retail too. Although she only generates minimal income from her businesses, she still manages well rather than lazing at home. She hopes to continue to improve her success as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more papaya soap and rice to sell

loans.name: Precious Angely

texts.en: Precious Angely is 18 years old. She is the daughter of Racquel who is a vendor living at Peñablanca. She is an incoming third year student taking up Bachelor of Science degree in Physical Education. Her parents had insufficient funds to sustain her needs and that is why she is asking for a loan of P 10,000 to pay for her tuition fees and buy books and uniforms. She aims to finish her education and land a good-paying job to help lift her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and buy books and uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana es comerciante, vende ropa, calzado, bolsos, sabanas, electrodomésticos menores etc y todo lo que solicita su clientela, para satisfacer sus necesidades, deseos e intereses.  La actividad de comerciante la aprendió de su madre, quien se dedicó a ella y la impulsó para que viajara a un pueblo fronterizo, para comprar mercancía y vender en su barrio.  Ellos le pagaban a crédito y con lo que recuperaba semanalmente, quincenalmente o mensualmente de sus cuentas por cobrar, compraba  lo que sus clientes le habían encargado. Hoy sigue ese mismo ritmo, vendiendo a crédito y de contado, y requiere ampliar su negocio con una mayor diversidad de productos y adicionalmente como su madre enfermó y ella vende cervezas y refrescos, necesita retomar ese negocio para aumentar sus ingresos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará refrescos, cervezas y un congelador, con ello tendrá otros ingresos y podrá ayudar aun mas a los gastos de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 4 años. Liliana abre su negocio desde la 3 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche y vende a crédito y de contado haciendo muchos esfuerzos con el fin de alcanzar su meta de mejorara las condiciones de su negocio, tener su propia casa mas adelante a aunque su mayor desafío sea, el tener suficiente dinero para alcanzar sus propósitos.
texts.en:
Liliana is a merchant who sells clothes, shoes, bags, linens, small household appliances, and anything else that her customers request so that she can satisfy their needs, wants, and interests. She learned the business from her mother who was in the same line of work and encouraged her to travel to a border town in order to buy merchandise that she could sell in her neighborhood. Liliana purchased her goods on credit and collected payments from her customers weekly, biweekly, or monthly for the items they had ordered so that she could pay the bills. Today she continues in the same manner, selling on credit or for cash.

In order to expand her business, Liliana needed a wider variety of products. In addition, her mother was selling beer and soft drinks before she became ill. Liliana took over that business so that she could increase earnings. For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy soft drinks, beer, and a freezer. This will give her additional income, which will be of great help with the household expenses. Her family consists of her husband and her four-year-old son.

Liliana opens her business at 3:00 P.M. and continues on until 11:00 P.M. She sells on credit and for cash. Liliana is putting forth great effort in order to accomplish her goal of improving the condition of her business. Owning a home in the future will be a great challenge for her since she needs to have sufficient funds to reach that goal.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, and a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy shoes and biscuits.

loans.name: Vilma Soledad

texts.es:
Vilma Soledad tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto con su cónyuge en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cerdos, cuyes, pavos y patos, desde hace más de 02 años aproximadamente, brinda servicio como jornalero agrícola en las chacras de sus vecinos, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 900 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores que le permitan ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Vilma Soledad is 34 years old, lives with her husband in the district of Lagunas, a community devoted to agriculture, commerce and cattle, located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region in the Northern coast of Peru.

She raises small animals like pigs, guinea pigs, turkeys and ducks. 

Since about two years ago, she has also been working as a day laborer in the farms of her neighbors. 

She counts with a sizable clientele. She has requested a loan from Admyme Alternative for of 1,900 new soles to buy small animals that will allow her to sell them at a lower price.

loans.use: to buy small animals which will allow her to offer them at better prices.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal “KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Wilmer se dedica al negocio de venta de bloquetas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de bloquetas.El socio solicita el credito para comprar bloquetas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Kimoyganaker Maganiroigi." The bank is located in the district of Echarate, and belongs to the province of La Convención and the Department of Cusco. 

Wilmer works in his business selling "bloquetas" or different types of bricks.  He works from 8am until 6pm. He has several years of experience in this business.  His dream is to grow the business and sell more bricks. He is asking for a loan to buy bricks. 

He is happy about this loan and promises to comply with the repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy bricks.

loans.name: Ream's Group

texts.en: Riem, originally from the Bovel district of Battambang province, is 45 years old. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school. For her household, rice farming and soldier officer are the sources of the income she earns to feed the family. It is the business that she has been involved in for 10 years, which has returned her with a decent income. Including this cycle, Riem is a third-time borrower while her co-borrower is a first-time borrower. Now, her condition of living is getting better from her past loans and she has completely paid back her loans. She is requesting a loan for 2,000,000 KHR and her group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will manage her portion of the loan to buy seeds and to pay plowing fees. She strongly hopes that her lifestyle will be better than before.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 49-year-old hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been selling alcohol since 1992, in addition to hawking and motorcycle transport to earn a living. He hopes to construct a good house despite the price fluctuations of alcohol. Edward is asking for a loan to buy more jerrycans of alcohol to sell.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of alcohol to sell

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Las Emprendedoras” y está conformada por 08 mujeres entusiastas decididas  a comenzar a trabajar. Elizabeth de 25 años de edad  separada con 3 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Elizabeth ha logrado brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hogar. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de Turrones, caramelos y chupetines. El deseo de Elizabeth es contar con un local propio donde pueda mostrar sus productos. El nuevo grupo “Las Emprendedoras” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Elizabeth se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y lleva en brazo a su bebe.
texts.en: This is the new communal banking group "Las Emprendedoras" or "Enterprising Women." It is made up of 8 enthusiastic women who have decided to begin working. Elizabeth is 25 years old and separated from her husband. She has three children in her care.  She works selling candies.  With great effort and determination, she has been able to offer a better quality of life to her family.  She is asking for a loan to purchase turrón, caramels, and lollypops.  Her desire is to have her own store where she can demonstrate and sell her products.  The new group "Enterprising Women" is thankful to the people who will make their loan possible.  Elizabeth is in the back of the photograph. She is the second from the left and is holding a baby in her arms.

loans.use: to purchase turrón, caramels, and lollypops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fabric

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto con su conyugue y sus tres menores hijos de edades 13, 7 y 1 mes de nacido, en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera como camas, ventanas, roperos entre otros, para ofrecerlo a sus clientes, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de madera para elaborar sus muebles.
texts.en:
Elmer is 33 years old, lives in his own house made of rustic materials along with his wife and three younger children aged 13, 7 and one month, in the district of Pucará, having a population working in agriculture, commerce and cattle, located in the province of Jaen which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the Northern mountains of Peru.

He manufactures wooden furniture like beds, windows, closets and others to offer to his clients. He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternitiva of 500 new soles to buy wood from which to craft his furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood to manufacture furniture.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna, who is a 24-year-old young woman, lives in the village of Sartichala. She has a husband and two infants. Her husband is an artisan and monthly he generates approximately 300 GEL. Khatuna doesn't have any stable activity. Thus, she is involved in an agribusiness. In particularl, Khatuna takes care of several chickens and sells eggs locally. She generates an insignificant income that isn't enough for her four-member family. Khatuna has a great desire to start a stable activity and requested a loan. Her application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. She plans to purchase stock of clothing in Turkey and in the local wider market and sell it among her villagers.
 
This new activity will greatly help her to satisfy her children's increased needs and make a better living condition. Khatuna and her family will be thankful for all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start a trading business with clothing

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul used the previous loan to buy cows for milk production. He has been a farmer for over 10 years and he has done this so that he could be able to sustain his family. He wants to buy a plot of land for building with the loan. His future hope is to build a permanent house if all goes well. His food crops are affected by hailstones, strong winds and unexpected downpours due to changes in weather.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for building a home in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Angelica Giovanna

texts.es:
Angelica es una joven emprendedora, tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como secretaria en una empresa, le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación.
Angelica está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá commprar mercadería para inicar un pequeño negocio de ferretería con los cual obtendrá otros ingresos adicionales para seguir apoyando a su familia en todo lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Angelica, 36, is a young entrepreneur who is single and lives in Ica with her family.  For several years she has been working at a company as a secretary and it is going very well for her because she is a responsible, hard-working person who is determined to get ahead.

Angelica is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support she will be able to buy merchandise to start her small hardware business.  This will allow her to earn extra income to support the family in everything they need.

loans.use: To start a small hardware business.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a hardworking mom who makes a living with her own farm. She has a rice farm where she earns well while her husband works as an electrician.

Esterlita has been farming for more than 13 years. She works with determination with her husband in order to provide for her family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the farm. Assured of having a better future, she was determined to have it.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the farm.

loans.name: Rorn's Group

texts.en: A villager located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia, Rorn is 53 years old. To overcome her financial burden, she grows rice as the main source of income, which she has done for 30 years. This is the fourth-cycle loan for Rorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader of a group consisting of three members. She has fully repaid her previous loan with a positive impact on her family. The entire loan for her group is 3,800,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to upgrade her family so they are better off than before.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 38 years of age, married and blessed with three children. Two of her children are married and her youngest child goes to school. Anita offers meat, fish and various kinds of vegetables within her local community.

Anita started her business with capital of PHP 4,000. With her hard work and initiative, she was able to improve her sales and income. This time, she is using her motorcycle to sell the goods she offers within her locality. She is thankful because through her husband's support, she was able to keep her business productive and profitable through her previous loans. Now, she would like to purchase more kilograms of meat, fish and vegetables to sell, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000. She knows that through this additional capital, she will be able to send her youngest child to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To purchase various kinds of vegetables, meat and fish to be sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por sus cuatro hijos y su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura dese hace varios años especialmente al cultivo del  güisquil, comercializa en los alrededores d la zona, Mauricio está solicitando un crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: fertilizantes, controles de plagas, abonos, etc.  y así poder seguir cumpliendo sus compromisos como padre de familia ya que esa es su única fuente de  ingresos y  así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
