She is asking for a loan in her third cycle of 12,000 lempiras to buy rice, corn, beans, cleaning products, flour, butter, sugar and other products to stock her business. 

She hopes to generate the necessary income to be able to look after her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to stock her store.

loans.name: Andrés Adelio

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 38 años de edad, por diversas situaciones de su familia él no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pero es una persona emprendedora con un gran entusiasmo por el trabajo, hoy en día está acompañado y ha procreado siete hijos , su esposa solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuidado de sus hijos mientras él trabaja en el campo cultivando granos básicos, y tiene aproximadamente 20 años de realizar esta actividad, el trabajo lo hace en la misma 
comunidad donde reside y hace un recorrido de 10 minutos a pie para llegar al lugar.

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar ocho quintales de fertilizantes, por lo que ya en este momento no es nada fácil el trasladar el abono hasta la casa debido al camino.

Él sueña con tener una parcela para trabajar y tiene claro que la única manera de hacer realidad su sueño es esforzándose, quiere dejarles un lugar donde vivir a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Andres, 38, did not have the chance to study because of the situation his family found themselves in.  However, he is a very enterprising man who is very enthusiastic about working.  

He is married and has seven children.  His wife takes care of the housework and looks after the children while he works in the fields growing basic grains.  He has been working in this activity for about 20 years. 

He does his work in the same area where he lives and has a ten minute walk to his place of work.

He is asking for a loan from Credicampo to buy eight quintals of fertilizer.  This will help him because at the moment he has difficulty in having to keep transporting compost to the fields.

He dreams of having his own plot of land where he can work.  He is convinced that the only way to achieve this is to keep working hard; and then he will be able to leave his children with a place to live.

loans.use: to buy eight quintals of fertilizer.

loans.name: Jansis Francisco

texts.es:
Jansis tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casado y su pareja trabaja en una empresa de galletas, tiene un hijo y nadie mas depende de Jansis.


Él  se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 15 años de realizar la actividad productiva, su padre y madre son quienes le enseñaron el respeto al prójimo y a si mismos, por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura, ha sido un hombre responsable y el trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie y trabaja en un horario de 6:00 a 11:00 AM.

El préstamo será invertido para la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra, pagará mano de obra y comprará los insumos necesarios para el cultivo de maíz. 

Sueña con tener siempre lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
Jansis is 26 years old and studied through the 9th grade. He is married with one son, and his wife works in a cookie shop. No one else depends on Jansis for financial support. 

He works in agriculture and already has more than 15 years of experience in the field. His mother and father taught him to respect his neighbor and himself because the type of work in this zone is solely centered on agriculture. He has been a responsible man, and his work is very close to home. He can walk to work and is there from 6 until 11 in the morning. 

The loan will be invested in the preparation of the land for seeding. He will pay hired hands and will buy the necessary supplies to grow corn. He dreams of always having what is necessary to take care of his family, which is why he hopes to work for as long as God blesses him with health and life.

loans.use: to prepare the land for seeding, to pay hired hands, and to buy the necessary supplies to grow corn.

loans.name: Jose Antonio Virgilio

texts.es: José tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hermana de 32 años de edad. José se gana la vida trabajando como jornalero. Es un hombre conocido en su comunidad por su dedicación al trabajo y su responsabilidad. José ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila para reguardar el agua dado que la pila que tiene es muy pequeña. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, ladrillo, arena, lámina y madera. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción  lo antes posible.
texts.en: Jose, 27, lives in his own house with his 32 year-old sister.  Jose earns a living by working as a laborer.  His is a man who is well-known in his community for his dedication to his work and for his responsibility.  Jose has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a basin to store water, because the one that he has is very small.  With this loan, he will buy cement, bricks, sand, corrugated metal, and wood.  He hopes to obtain this financing so that he can start this construction project as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en: Nazik is an experienced agronomist from Nor Kharberd village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband and three children. To take care of her family Nazik is engaged in keeping pigs and piglets and cultivation of wheat and greens. With the help of her husband she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family’s income. As the family’s needs are increasing with time, Nazik is thinking of expanding her agribusiness to make ends meet. She currently cultivates greens in the greenhouse and wants to start cultivation of different plants in the greenhouse. For that reason she wants to build a new greenhouse. To reach that goal, Naira needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of USD 3000 to purchase 3 pigs. Nazik and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and appreciates their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for 3 pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food containers, cups, and knifes to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more body cream, perfume and hair relaxer to expand her business.

loans.name: Leanghouy's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Leanghouy is 50 years old and married. She has six children. To support the family, she and her husband have been working as a teacher and supplementing the family’s income by selling snacks. Having been in this business for 11 years, she is able to earn about 56,000 KHR per day. 

Leanghouy has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family in having sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more snacks to resell. She hopes to increase her family’s income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more snacks to resell

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Phnom Prek district, Leang is 32 years old and married with two children. To make a living and support her family, Leang and her husband have been growing cassava and corn as their primary businesses for ten years and she supplements the income by working for others for a fee.
This is the second micro loan for Leang with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is seeking a loan to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan she hopes to cultivate her cassava and corn to earn more income to improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and purchase educational equipment for her oldest daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Phnom Prek district in the Battambang province, Sophea is a 26-year-old married mother of one son who is still too small for school. Rice farming and cassava growing have been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years. To better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband also works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn enough to use 46,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and save about 50,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Sophea is a member of a two-person group that has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the previous loan. The first loan helped Sophea better support her family members. Now she is applying for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily, and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of electronics items like cables, light fans, plugs, bulbs. radios and switches.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 44-year-old married mother of four whose husband works in furniture repair. She took over her family’s tailoring business from her parents and the revenues she makes from the shop help her pay for her children‘s private school education. Her business attracts a number of customers from around her neighborhood who are impressed by the high quality of her work. 

Mona is an ambitious woman who believes in taking advantage of every opportunity in life. She acquired a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua  so that she can scale her business and increase her productivity in order to generate more revenue, through buying new tailoring machine that will help her improve her business production.

loans.use: To buy a new tailoring machine that will help her improve her business production.

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
Sreyoun is aged 32 years and married with three children, two of whom are in school while another one is too young for school. Her family lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district. She and her husband earn a living through selling grocery items and working as a construction worker.  

Sreyoun has only just become a member of VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is seeking for a loan to buy a decent motorbike for her family’s commuting. She hopes to reduce her expenses for motor-taxis.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her family’s commuting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Seanglim

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Kong Meas district, Seanglim is a 55-year-old widowed mother of four children. As a widowed mother, she has struggled to feed her children by growing rice. To better support the family, she sells fish in her village. The current business earns her about 93,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 50,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Seanglim has already been with VisionFund for two cycles. The past loans have helped her to better support her family and increase the business. Now she is requesting a new loan to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy is 36 years old and married. Her family lives in a rural area of the Bovel district in the Battambang province. Vy has been growing cassava and working as a paid worker. Having been in this business for 16 years, she is able to earn about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Vy has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely repaid the previous loans. Now she is requesting a new loan to buy seeds and pay for plowing the field. She hopes to grow more cassava and sell them for a good price, thus generating a higher income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing the field

loans.name: Ma. Luzel

texts.en:
Ma. Luzel is 34 years old and married with 4 children.  With two children in school, Ma. Luzel works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luzel's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ma. Luzel has restarted her mat-making business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ma. Luzel has taken a PHP 7,385 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ma. Luzelis is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is an experienced farmer from Marmarashen village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband and four children. To be able to meet her family’s needs Lusine, with the help of her husband, is extensively engaged in agribusiness. They keep chickens and cultivate greens and potatoes. Lusine's husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for them. 

Now, Lusine wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to effectively meet the growing needs of her family. A loan of USD 3,000 will help her greatly enabling her to renovate the barn and the greenhouse which the own. Lusine and her husband highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount of loan.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the barn and greenhouse.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Ms. Bolormaa is 29 years old and lives with her mother and younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

She has a grocery and has run the shop for 2 years. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugrigs) to install an electric heater in her shop, which means they won't use coal in winter. This is useful in controlling air pollution. The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who needs the help of lenders.

loans.use: to install an electric heater.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos,  el tiene un taller de costura desde hace 36 años ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad y los buenos precios. Gilberto está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: hilos, agujas, telas, mantenimiento de equipo entre otras cosas, y así poderles dar a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Gilberto is 56 years old. He lives in his own home with his three children. He has had a sewing workshop located in his home for 36 years. He has many customers due to the quality and good prices of his work. Gilberto is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials like thread, needles, fabric, equipment maintenance and other things. He can give his children better economic stability without any limitations.

loans.use: purchase thread, needles, fabric and other items.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Phat is aged 42 years and married. She has three children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for 22 years.

This is the first micro loan for Phat with VisionFund. She is now seeking for a loan to buy seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
A mother of four children, Yan is a villager from Bovel district of Battambang province. She is 64 years old and she is a farmer who does rice farming as the main source of income and has a paid-working job to have additional income for her family. This current business earns her 27,400 KHR per day. Yan has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three previous loans which she has completely repaid back successfully. The past loans that she took have enabled her to provide sufficient food for her family and to save. 

For this cycle, she is a leader of five members who are requesting a loan. She and her group members are requesting a loan of the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Yan as a leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay for labor and plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes to expand her current business and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay for labor and plowing fees.

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
Sokunthea is aged 24 years and is widowed with one daughter. To make a living, she has been raising pigs. With the current business, she can earn about 34,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs and is able to save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is Sokunthea’s group loan with VisionFund and she has just joined VisionFund this cycle. With a good business, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy pig feeds for her pig. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds for her pig.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is a 49-year-old married woman from the village of Khibula. She lives with her husband, daughter and son, who is a teacher at a local public school and generates 170 GEL monthly. The family runs a small agricultural activity. They have two milk cows and two buffalo and also a plot of agricultural land, where they harvest beans and corns. All things considered, they still find it hard to satisfy basic needs and all the family expenses. That's why Mzia requested a loan to start a new business and somehow improve her family's living conditions. She will start a trading business and generate her own income. Mzia plans to purchase a stock of grocery goods at low prices for the specified region and will sell with increased prices to the nearby villages.

The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need. Mzia awaits your support.

loans.use: to start trading with grocery goods

loans.name: Kanha Rem

texts.en: Kanha Rem, 29, is married and living with her family in a village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has one daughter. For the last year, Kanha Rem and her husband have been farming rice and selling grocery items. Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business.  Kanha Rem has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Chamroen

texts.en: Chamroen is 29 years old and married with two children. He lives in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province, where crop farming a common way to make a living. To make a living, he has been growing vegetables and working as a garment worker. He is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Chamroen has been with VisionFund for one cycle. He completely paid back the past loan. Now he is seeking a new loan to buy vegetable seeds and pay for labor fees. He hopes to grow his vegetables well so as to better his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en:
Djeyhun is a master: he applies wallpaper, makes putty and more. He is 33 years old and single. Djeyhun is living with his parents in the Abseron region. The family members are internally displaced persons (IDP) who had to leave their home, which was in the city of Khojaly. 

Today Djeyhun wants to support his business, and for this reason he has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan in the amount of 1,000 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN). With this amount, he is planning that to buy materials necessary for his work. He says he has great thankfulness for the dear Kiva organization. In the future, he wants to get married and have children.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 55 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su hijo y su esposo, ella tiene una tienda y tortillería que se encuentra en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar. María está solicitando un crédito para capital de trabajo, compra de mercadería para la tienda como: verduras, frutas, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 55 years old. She lives in a rented home with her son and husband. She has a store and tortilla shop located in her home. With what she earns from her work and with the help from her husband, they can move ahead with the household expenses.  María is requesting a loan for working capital in order to purchase merchandise for the store like vegetables, fruits, basic grains, candy, soft drinks, etc. She will able to continue with her work and have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, fruits, basic grains, candy, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 50-year-old, IDP person (internally displaced person) who lives with her kids in Bilasuvar region. Maryam is a hardworking woman; she is taking care of her kids alone because her husband died. She applied for a loan with Aqroinvest for the first time when she found out that it was possible to receive financial support.  She does not have a higher education, and did not have the opportunity to study at university because of financial difficulties in the family. She is a homemaker, and takes care of the household and the children. Maryam raises and sells cattle and also sells cow's milk, earning a good income. She currently wants to acquire more cattle and expand her business. She applied for a loan 1,500 AZN to purchase more cattle. She hopes very much for a positive outcome and thanks Aqroinvest  in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 52 years old, married and has 14 children. Four of them are in school.

Divina and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. However, her business and her family home were wiped out. 

Divina is taking out a housing loan in the amount of PHP 9,975 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Divina has been with NWTF as a borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her mat-making.

With your help, Divina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her mat-making business and is now requesting a PHP 9,685 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Elsa will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Khmao

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Khmao is 36 years old and married, with three children. 

To support her family, she has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland for 18 years. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 50,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs. 

Khmao has been with VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition in the faculty of Electrical Engineering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school tuition for her son.

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.en: This is the first loan for Navbahor from IMON. She is a kind woman who is 40 years old. Navbahor is married and has 5 children. Navbahor has been busy with growing agriculture products for more than 10 years. She grows crops on 2 ha of land. Navbahor’s husband helps her to grow crops. She sells the harvest in a local market. Navbahor is a caring mother for her children. She always tries to offer the best living conditions for her children. Navbahor is going to repair her house because of the poor living conditions. Navbahor is asking for a loan of 600 USD to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. to repair the house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. to repair the family house

loans.name: Antonio Angel

texts.es: Antonio tiene 28 años de edad y trabaja como jornalero en una hacienda cercana a su localidad. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y el agua se filtra cuando llueve. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Antonio is 28 years old and works as a day laborer on a ranch near his town. This is how he makes a living and covers his living expenses. With a great desire to improve his living conditions, he applied for this loan with FUSAI to invest in improvements in the roof of his home. The roof is in disrepair and water leaks when it rains. With the requested support, he will buy zinc-coated steel sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy zinc-coated steel sheets, wood, and nails to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Banguka I Group

texts.fr:
Virginie fait partie du groupe Banguka  II  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 45  ans et est mariée à Berchmans, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de  banane depuis  8 ans. 

Elle est à son seizième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer de la bière  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, elle  voudrait  construire une clôture  de  sa parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Virginie is part of the group Banguka II and lives in Gitega. She is a 45 years old and married to Berchmans, a merchant. Together they have six children, all students.

Virginie has been doing commerce in banana beer for eight years. 

She is on her 16th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of bananas to make beer to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to build a fence around her plot of land and to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to make beer, so as to earn more

loans.name: Iyubake Group

texts.fr:
Pétrone fait partie du groupe Iyubake et  habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de   42  ans et elle a 7 enfants. 

Elle fait le commerce de farine  de manioc  depuis  14 ans. 

Elle est à son treizième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de manioc sec à transformer en farine à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Pétrone is part of the group Iyubake and lives in Gitega. She is a 42-year-old widow and has seven children. 

She has been doing commerce in cassava flour for fourteen years. 

She is on her 14th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of dried cassava to process into flour to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of dried cassava to process into flour, so as to earn more

loans.name: Jonabelle

texts.en: Jonabelle is 34 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Jonabelle works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jonabelle has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 9,800 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Jonabelle is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is a married woman with 7 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lalyn is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

Lalyn's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Lalyn is taking out a PHP 9,485 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Lalyn has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit of her aim to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Lalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Qizbas

texts.en: Qizbas is 49 years old, and married with two kids. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with her family in Bilasuvar region. Qizbas has a small plantation and grows fruit trees and vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She is asking for the support of Kiva lenders because she wants to grow a different crop like potatoes this season. She needs a loan 1,200 AZN to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds of the highest quality to plant. Therefore, she can diversify the income of her household and stop depending on bean crops to be able to support the needs of her children and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds to plant.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and has seven children. She is married and has 6 children who are in school.

Jocelyn  and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home werer wiped out. 

Jocelyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,250 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Jocelyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her pig fattening business.

With your help, Jocelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition for her son.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super-typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her tailoring business and is now requesting a PHP 9,685 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Noeme will be able to rebuild her devastated life more quickly.

In the future, Noeme would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in Darbas village of Syunik region. 

She is an experienced farmer from Darbas village of Syunik region. Her family consists of her husband and father-in-law. With the help of her family members, Ruzanna is extensively engaged in an agribusiness. She is involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding livestock of sheep and pigs, and in cultivation of emmer wheat, barley and potatoes. The family sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of the family’s income. 

To sustain her agribusiness Ruzanna needs to make some investments in it. A loan of USD 1,500 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family and will enable her to purchase two cows. Ruzanna and her family members rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more material for printing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her university enrollment fees and materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase containers of peanut oil

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 54 years old, married, with ten children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Susan's house was destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her mat-making business and is committed to regaining what she lost. 

Susan is taking out a PHP 9,485 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Susan has been with NWTF since 2012, in her pursuit of her rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start, once more, in a new home. 

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Johaana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con esfuerzo, Johaana ha logrado surtir su pulpería con una variedad  de productos alimenticios para el hogar. Su local es pequeño, sin embargo,  da  respuesta a las demandas del todo el público que lo visita.  Su negocio goza de buena reputación en su comunidad por la excelente atención que ofrece  diariamente. 
Johaana lleva nueve años en el mundo del comercio.  Sus ventas  le generan buenas ganancias que le sirven para abastecer su local. Ella tomó la mejor decisión de su vida, que fue unirse a la familia de KIVA MiCrédito.  Su propósito es  conseguir el capital necesario para comprar más productos alimenticios. Entre sus planes futuros,  planea abrir negocio en las afueras de algún hospital capitalino, también desea adquirir un vehículo y mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
With effort, Johaana has managed to fill her store with a variety of groceries for the home. Her place is small, yet it responds to the demands of all the customers who visit. Johaana's business enjoys a good reputation in her community for the excellent service she offers every day.

Johaana has nine years in the world of commerce. Her sales generate good profits that serve to support her store. She made ​​the best decision of her life, which was to join the family of KIVA MiCrédito. Her purpose now is to raise the necessary capital to buy more grocery stock. Among her future plans, Johaana plans to open a business outside a hospital in the capital, and she also wishes to acquire a vehicle and improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to buy more grocery stock

loans.name: Marko

texts.en: Marko is 28 years old and single, living with his entire family in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. His parents are both employed doing administrative jobs, but Marko works at an Internet and TV agency to help contribute to the family’s income. Despite all of the income combined, the money that they are generating is still not enough to meet their daily needs and improve their living conditions by renovating their house. Because of their low salaries, the house is in poor condition and has been without repairs for a while now. For this reason, he wants to help his family and is requesting a loan in order to purchase material for a façade and renovations to have a better standard of living. He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a façade and renovations to have a better standard of living.

loans.name: Anabelen

texts.es:
Anabelen es una joven de 23 años nació en La Paz – Bolivia, es soltera y tiene una hermana, su principal inspiración en la vida fue su abuelo, quien la ayudo en su vida escolar pero no cumplió con su sueño de ver a su nieta salir Bachiller pues falleció días antes, dejando solas a su hermana mayor y a ella ya que él era su única familia. 
Anabelen a partir de sus 19 años empezó a trabajar y fue el sustento de su hogar, ya que su hermana mayor trabajaba eventualmente. Al ser su anheló tener una profesión, Anabelen decidió estudiar en una universidad que le permitiera trabajar por las tardes. En un inicio decidió estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas pero al no poder cumplir con todos los requisitos de la misma, decidió cambiarse a la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, donde encontró su verdadera pasión.
Actualmente Anabelen vive sola y trabaja en el área de marketing de su universidad ya que obtuvo un empleo-beca de estudio; los ingresos que percibe cubre los gastos de su hogar, pero no así los de la universidad, por lo que solicito un crédito educativo para poder concluir sus estudios y cumplir con su sueño de ser profesional y así tener la posibilidad de crear una empresa que ayude a los jóvenes profesionales que no pudieron encontrar trabajo.
Anabelen agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a los jóvenes y generan nuevas oportunidades para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Anabelen, age 23, was born in La Paz, Bolivia.  She is single, and she has a sister.  Her main inspiration in life was her grandfather.  He helped her with her school life, but he did not fulfill his dream of seeing his granddaughter get her high school diploma.  He died a few days before that, leaving her and her older sister alone.  He was her only family.

Anabelen started working at age 19, and she was the household’s support.  Her older sister worked eventually.  Because she yearned to have a profession, Anabelen decided to study at a university that would allow her to work in the afternoons.  In the beginning she decided to study the career of systems engineering.  However, when she was not able to fulfill all of the requirements, she decided to change to commercial engineering.  This is where she found her true passion.

Anabelen lives alone and works in area of marketing for the university.  She got a work-study grant. The income that she gets covers the household expenses.  However, this is not the case with the university expenses.  

Therefore, she is requesting an educational loan to be able to complete her studies and fulfill her dream of being a professional.  This way she will have the possibility of creating a business that helps young professionals who are not able to find work.

Anabelen is grateful to the people who use their financial resources to help young people and generate new opportunities for their education.

loans.use: to pay for her degree in commercial engineering.

loans.name: Adolfo Rex

texts.es: Adolfo Rex: Es un hombre trabajador, tiene 62 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, mayores de edad e independientes. Desde hace más de 15 años, estableció  su taller de mecánica y vulcanización con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y con los ingresos percibidos y créditos anteriores otorgados por PANA PANA, le han permitido comprar un taxi. Con el objetivo de ampliar su microempresa y mejorar la condición de sus vehículos solicita financiamiento para comprar equipos y materiales para su taller: compresores, láminas y varillas para soldar. Su sueño es comprar un bus, para que cubra la ruta de Puerto Cabezas a Managua.
texts.en: Adolfo Rex is a hard-working man. He is 62 years old and married. He has three children who are older in age and independent. More than 15 years ago, he established a mechanic's and vulcanization workshop with the intention of improving the quality of life of his family. With the income received and the previous loans from PANA PANA, he was able to purchase a taxi. With the objective of expanding his micro-business and improving the condition of his vehicles, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase equipment and materials for his workshop like compressors, sheeting and soldering rods. His dream is to purchase a bus, to cover the route from Puerta Cabezas to Managua.

loans.use: purchase equipment and materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Subadra

texts.en:
Subadra is 46 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 18.  

Many years ago, Subadra established  her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan Business and Professional Women (PBPW) and she used her most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizer.  

In the future, Subadra plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 
 
Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. 

With a Kiva loan, PBPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gyanu

texts.en:
Gyanu is 50 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 30 and 26. 

In 2008, Gyanu established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan Business and Professional Women (PBPW) and she used her most recent one to buy small chickens for her business. 

In the future, Gyanu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine, to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Dúo Bethel Group

texts.es: Dúo Bethel este dúo esta conformado por la señora Angela de 61 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta producto comestibles desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas insumos para su tienda ya que sus clientes han aumentado y encecita mas capital para seguir trabajando y salir adelante.
texts.en: The Bethel duo includes Angela, who is 61 years old. She sells consumable products and has done so for many years. At this time she is requesting this loan to purchase more supplies for her store because her client base has grown and she needs more capital to continue working and to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase consumables to sell.

loans.name: Darou Mbitéyène 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit nommé « Darou Mbitèye 1 », associe deux femmes qui s’activent dans l’agriculture depuis plus de cinq ans. La responsable, madame Fatou, habillée en bleu sur la photo travaille avec son époux dans son champs. Elle prend des crédits pour acheter les semences et son mari prépare l’espace cultural en attendant les premières pluies. En dehors de cela, Fatou fait du petit commerce qui leur permet d’assurer le quotidien de la famille.
Son projet pour l’avenir serait d’améliorer son activité en y associant l’embouche de moutons ou de chèvres.
texts.en: The group named Darou Mbitèye 1 brings together two women who have been practicing farming for more than five years. The head of the group, Mrs. Fatou, dressed in blue in the photo, works with her husband on his field. She takes loans to buy seeds and her husband prepares the land while waiting for the first rains. Outside of this, Fatou sells things, which allows them to take care of the family’s daily expenses. Her goal for the future would be to improve her business by getting into the fattening of sheep and goats.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to augment his capital and buy a lot of planks to sell to earn more money

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Darou Mbitéyène 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit appelé « Darou Mbitèye 5 » est aussi une association de deux femmes qui ont comme activité, l’agriculture. Elles travaillent dans les champs avec leurs maris respectifs car à elles seules, elles ne peuvent cultiver toute seule ces périmètres. La responsable, la dame Anta, en écharpe noire, va prendre ce crédit pour acheter des semences et de l’engrais et préparer l’hivernage. La dépense quotidienne est gérer par son mari et elle l‘appui dans la gestion de l’éducation des enfants avec les cours de renforcement qu’elle leur paie pour les permettre d’être à jour.
Anta aimerait cultiver des légumes et les revendre elle-même afin d’augmenter les sources de revenus du foyer.
texts.en: The group named Darou Mbitèye 5 is also a group of two women who farm. They work in the fields with their respective husbands, as they wouldn’t be able to do it alone. The head of the group, the lady Anta, in the black scarf, is taking this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to prepare for the rainy season. The daily expenses are managed by her husband and she supports him in the management of their children’s education with the core classes that she pays for to allow them to be there during the day. Anta would like to grow vegetables and sell them herself in order to increase her household’s income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.es: Nehemias tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijo de 2 años y 9 años de edad. Nehemias trabaja como jornalero desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del piso dado que actualmente es de tierra. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
Nehemias is 30 years old and he lives in his own house with his partner and their two children, who are two and nine years old. 

Nehemias has worked as a day laborer for quite some time, which allows him to support the household. 

In hopes of improving their living conditions, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in upgrading the floor, given that it is currently made of dirt. With the amount requested he will buy cement, sand and gravel.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand and gravel for cementing the floor of his home.

loans.name: T Ania Eleana

texts.es: Tania Eliana: Es una mujer amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, madre soltera de 3 hijos, que estudian su primaria. Cuenta con una experiencia de 5 años, como docente. Con el objetivo de suplir gastos escolares y pagar colegiatura solicita financiamiento. Su sueño es apoyar al desarrollo profesional de sus hijos.
texts.en: Tania Eliana is a kind woman originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is the single mother of the three children who are in primary school. She has five years of experience as a teacher. With the objective of supplying school expenses and tuition, she is requesting a loan. Her dream is to support the professional development of her children.

loans.use: with school costs and tuition.

loans.name: Nitisha

texts.en: Nitisha is 26 years old, married and has one child, age 7. In 2009, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy small chickens for her business. In the future, Nitisha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel, because he hopes to cement the floor of his house.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en: Sarita is 26 years old, married and has one child, age 3.  Many years ago, she established her ready-made clothing business. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy different types of ready-made clothes like shirts, pants, and jackets.  In the future, Sarita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her shop

loans.name: Obaatanpa Group

texts.en:
These women are part of Obaatanpa (good mother) group which consists of six people who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. They are selling provisions, cooked food, foodstuff, rice, oil, banku (cooked corn paste) and fish.

The representative for this group, named Lovelace, sells foodstuff. Lovelace is 47 years old and she is married to a security guard named Charles. The couple has three children, all in school and who are their dependents. Lovelace lives with her ​​husband and children, and handles together with her ​​husband the various family expenditures.

For the past twenty-nine years Lovelace has been running a business selling yam, plantain and cassava at the market. She travels to the farmers to buy yam, plantain and cassava, and sell to customers.   

Seeking for customer satisfaction and wanting to increase her turnover, Lovelace is requesting for the second time a loan from ID-Ghana. The previously granted loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: To buy yam, plantain and cassava to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her mat-making business and is now requesting a PHP 5,600 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Jenny will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 54 years old and married with 10 children, three in school. Criselda works very hard to provide for her family.

Criselda's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Criselda has restarted her food-vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Criselda has taken out a PHP 3,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials and to pay for labor to rebuild her family home.

Criselda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira is an entrepreneur who is married and has two children. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 10 years. With the passage of time, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to her animals' good condition, she has managed to gain a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and many of her customers are local butchers. 
Zamira is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new quality products and merchandise for her newborn and toy store

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 52 years old and married with two children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. William is a teacher and has been in that service for 14 years. He practices farming for additional income. He likes to socialize with children which inspired him to join the teaching profession. William wishes to improve his family's standard of living by educating his children. He is requesting money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed, with two children and one goes to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

Justine operates a retail shop. She works seven days a week .She has been in this business for the last 25 years. She gets additional income from farming. 

She has requested for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy cooking oil, sugar, soap, beans, blue band, salt, and crates of soda. 

Justine's major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to open up a mini-super market. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, soap, beans, blue band, salt, and crates of soda.

loans.name: Zinaddin

texts.en: Zinaddin is 46 years old. His family members have been internally displaced persons (IDP) from Füzuli city for 20 years and are now living in the Bilasuvar region. Zinaddin breeds cows, and his wife helps him in his  business, selling their milk and milk products such as yogurt and cheese. Now he wants to buy a milk cow to expand his enterprise and is therefore requesting a loan of 500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat).

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood and fabrics in addition to opening new production lines

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth: Es una señora alegre y sociable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 49 años de edad, casada con 8 hijos, mayores de edad. Su esposo trabaja en una institución del gobierno central. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde 6 años estableció su negocio de venta de postes de madera. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para incrementar su inventario y comprar en mayores cantidades postes de madera de pino y otras variedades. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en: Ruth is a happy and social woman from Puerto Cabezas. She is 49 years old and married with eight grown children. Her husband works at a central government institution. With the goal of having her own source of income, she established her business selling wood posts six years ago. She is applying for her second loan to increase her inventory and to buy larger quantities of wood posts in pine and other varieties.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and to buy larger quantities of wood posts in pine and other varieties.

loans.name: Martha Lee

texts.es: Martha Lee: Es una mujer luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, en edad escolar. Con el propósito de tener una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para cambiar la madera y zinc de la vivienda, debido a que desde hace aproximadamente 10 años no le realizada mejoras y la madera se encuentra en estado deteriorado. Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
Martha Lee, 31, is a persevering woman from Puerto Cabezas and the single mother of three school-age children.

She wants to have a safe and decent home, so she's requesting a loan to replace the wood and metal sheeting on her house.  She hasn't made any improvements on the house in about ten years and it's deteriorating.

Her dream is to give her family a home in suitable condition.

loans.use: to replace the wood and metal sheeting on her little house on stilts

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Babita is 37 years-old, married and has two children, ages 21 and 18.  Many years ago, she established  her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Babita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 
Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice and condiments.

loans.name: Dúo Orquideas Ll Group

texts.es: El Dúo  Orquideas II está conformado por doña Mirtala Adalia Maribel quien se dedica a la compra y venta de productos mexicanos ya que su domicilio tiene una pequeña tienda de productos ella solicita su crédito para lograr comprar productos  básicos (papel higiénico, pastas de dientes, jabón de baño, cereal, yogurt etc.) ya que necesita invertir pero no posee con suficiente dinero para surtir su negocio su meta es lograr construir en  su terreno su vivienda ya que desea darles un mejor futuro a sus 3 hijos que aun están pequeños.
texts.en:
Mirtala Adalia Maribel is in the "Dúo Orquideas II Group" (Two Orchids Group II). She makes a living buying and selling Mexican products, since she has a small shop with products where she lives. 

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy basic products (toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, cereal, yogurt, etc) because she does not have enough money to stock her shop. Her goal is to be able to build a house on her land since she hopes to give her three small children a better future.

loans.use: to buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sodabi, corn, cassava flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster the walls in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hibiscus flower leaves and sugar

loans.name: Darou Mbitéyène Group

texts.fr:
Madame Rokhy, est la responsable du groupe de crédit appelé « Darou Mbitéyene » C’est des femmes qui s’activent dans l’agriculture. Madame Rokhy, qui se trouve à gauche sur la photo, est la présidente, elle utilisera l’argent pour acheter des semences et de l’engrais et préparer l’hivernage. 
Elle est mariée et mère de famille et est très protectrice de ses enfants et de son foyer. Elle appuie moralement son mari et participe régulièrement à la dépense quotidienne.
Elle nourrit un projet où elle verra ses enfants travailler ensemble dans une même entreprise familiale et prendront la relève de leurs parents dans la gestion des dépenses.
texts.en: Mrs. Rokhy is the leader of the group named Darou Mbitéyene. These are women who practice farming. Mrs. Rokhy, who is on the left in the photo, is the president. She will use to money to buy seeds and fertilizer to prepare for the rainy season. She is a married mother and is very protective of her children and of her household. She morally supports her husband and regularly participates in managing the daily expenses. She cherishes a plan in which she will see her children work together in the same family business and succeed their parents in managing the expenditures.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Janilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Janilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening and food vending. Janilyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her jeepney transport business.

Janilyn  has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her jeepney.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is from Urasar village in the Lori region. She lives with her daughter and her husband is a migrant worker. To be able to meet the needs of her family, Laura is engaged in cattle and pig breeding and cultivating wheat and potatoes. With the help of her daughter, she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. To meet the growing needs of her family, Laura wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit. She needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase four oxen and to make previous credit repayments. Laura and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for four oxen and make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bedroom furniture

loans.name: Dúo Alotenango Group

texts.es: El Dúo Alotenango está formado por doña Maria Lina de 57 años de edad tiene más de 6 años que se dedica y posee una tienda donde vende su producto como granos básicos, venta de frutas, helados, y utensilios de cocina (ollas, trastes, cubiertos etc.) ella solicita su crédito para invertir ya que lo utilizara para comprar utensilios de cocina, tienda y para compra de frutas ya que actualmente han mejorados sus ventas y no cuenta con el capital suficiente para surtir mejor su negocio, su mayor anhelo es poder trabajar duro y más adelante lograr poder ahorrar para vivir sin penas su vejez.
texts.en: 57 year old Maria Lina is part of El Dúo Alotenango. For more than 6 years, she has owned and worked at a store where she sells her products such as basic grains, fruit, ice cream, and cookware (pots, utensils, silverware, etc.). She is asking for a loan to invest and will use it to buy cooking and store utensils, and to buy fruit. Her sales have improved recently and she doesn´t have enough money to better supply her business. Her greatest desire is to be able to work hard and in the future to be able to save to live without difficulties in her old age.

loans.use: to buy daily consumer products to sell

loans.name: Ivan Ufredo

texts.es:
Iván tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa e hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, en la comunidad La Palmira perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Iván  se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz y a la crianza de borregos y vacas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, y la alimentación de los animales. La compra lo realiza en Chillanes. Su meta es mejorar la venta de sus animales y la producción de maíz. Su desafío es el clima y las plagas en sus sembríos. En su tiempo libre le gusta estar con sus hijos y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Iván is 29 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children aged 2 and 4 in the Palmira community within the Chillanes Canton in the province of Bolivar.

He is a member of the communal bank La Palmira located in the La Palmira community, about 40 minutes from the office of the cooperative formed by the 14 members from the same community who work in agriculture.

Iván works in agriculture, growing corn and raising sheep and cows.

He requests a loan to buy compost and fertilizers and for feeding his animals. The purchase will be consummated in Chillanes.

His goal is to improve the sale of his animals and produce corn. His challenge is the weather and plagues in his crops. 

In his spare time he enjoys being with his children and doing sports.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and feed for his animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to supply her business with merchandise such as dyes and extensions etc.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Née en 1975, mariée et  mère de cinq (05) enfants ; Ablavi habite le quartier de Cassablanca . Elle vendait depuis 2005 des produits d’alimentation générale et depuis 2010 du riz avec haricots. Elle s’approvisionne  à gbossimé et une fois à la maison elle prépare et revend en restauration au bord de la route de son domicile.
Elle sollicite ce prêt pour agrandir son restaurant afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients et assurer une meilleure condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Born in 1975 and a married mother of five, Ablavi lives in the neighborhood of Cassablanca. Since 2005, she has been selling general food products, and since 2010, rice with beans. She stocks up at Gbossimé, and at home, she prepares and sells food at the side of the road from home. She is seeking this loan to grow her food-selling business in order to satisfy the needs of her customers and to ensure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of rice, 3 canisters of vegetable oil, and 30 bowls of beans

loans.name: Tito Raul

texts.es:
Tito vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, se dedica desde hace 4 años a la agricultura, especialmente en el cutlivo de cacao, el cual ha sembrado actualmente en una parcela de 2 hectareas, gracias a este oficio pude tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Tito esta agradecido con los prestamisats kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, dar mantenimiento a su cultivo entre otros y de esta manera tener una mejor cosecha, mejores ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una mejo calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Tito lives in the town of Pucallpa, he has been working in agriculture since he was four years old, particularly growing cocoa, which he has currently sowed in a parcel two hectares in size. Thanks to this line of work he can manage his household expenses and can move his family ahead.

Tito is grateful to all the Kiva lenders as he will be able to buy fertilizer, maintain his crop, among others, and in this way have a better harvest and fight for his great dream: “to have an improved quality of life."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maintain crops, among others.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 47 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mercedita has a snack food business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more snack food to sell in her food stall.

Mercedita has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack food to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: María Danelia

texts.es:
La señora maría es madre soltera  tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno esta en edad escolar ella cuenta con un  negocio de venta de leche, cuajada y crema en el mercado municipal de chichigalpa hace 8 años la señora es una mujer trabajadora ,emprendedora un día de trabajo inicia a las 4:00 am que se traslada de su casa hacia el mercado y finaliza a las 3:00 PM .

la señora maría es una mujer que le gusta el trabajo y tiene deseos de superación para ella y sus hijos una de los hijos esta en la universidad ella utiliza parte del préstamo para ayudarle con los gastos universitario los prestamos le han servido de mucha ayuda para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a single mother with 3 children, one of which is of school age. She’s had a business selling milk, curd, and cream in Chichigalpa’s minicipal market for 8 years. Maria is a hardworking, enterprising woman. A working day begins at 4:00AM, she goes from her home to the market, and it ends at 3:00 PM. 

Mrs. María is a woman who likes to work and has wishes, for her and her children, to excel. One of her children attends university; she uses part of the loan to help with the university expenses. The loans have been of much help to raise her 3 children.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products

loans.name: Darina

texts.en:
Darina is 52 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school. 

Darina is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Darina requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP through NWTF, in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Darina has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Darina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle is 37 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Giselle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF, in order to purchase more goods to sell.

Giselle has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, spices, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Giselle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF, in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for 25 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vicente De Los Angeles

texts.es: El señor Vicente tiene la edad de 56 años, esta acompañado y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales solamente 2 de ellos estan bajo su cargo. Don Vicente es una persona trabajadora, responsable,con metas por cumplir a corto plazo. Labora para la Alcaldia desde hace 14 años en donde se desempeña como guarda de seguridad. Nos comento que los creditos le han sido de gran ayuda porque le han permitido resolver problemas de salud de su señora. El tiene como meta a corto plazo construir su casa, ya que cuenta con un terreno y que por sus escasos recursos economicos no ha logrado este sueño y de esta forma darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Vicente is 56 years old, he has a partner and 4 children, of which only 2 of them are under his charge. Don Vicente is a hardworking, responsible person, with goals that need to be met in a short time. He has worked for the town hall for 14 years, where he serves as a security guard. 

He has mentioned to us that the loans have been a great help because they have allowed him to solve his partner’s health problems. 

He has as a short term goal of building a house given that he has land, but because of his scarce economic resources he has not been able to accomplish this dream and thus give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: medical expenses (operation)

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman is 57 years old, and married with four children. His elder son and daughter are both married, his younger son is studying his first course of college and his other daughter goes to school in the 10th class. His wife is a housewife. 

Telman is an IDP (Internally Displacted Person) from Fuzuli city and now he is living in Absheron region with his large and lovely family. Telman has a car and for 10 years he has been a taxi driver. Telman transports passengers between different areas of Abseron region. Today Telman wants to repair the interior of his car, and for that he has applied to Komak for a loan in amount of 600 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Telman says he is thankful for this loan, and thanks Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: to repair the interior of his taxi.

loans.name: Concepcion Elvira

texts.es: La señora Concepcion tiene la edad de 50 años, es casada y con 4 personas bajo su cargo, habita en una comunidad que esta a unos 70km de distacia llamada Larreynaga, cabe mencionar que doña Concepcion cuenta con unas vaquitas  y de la misma leche que producen sus vaquitas ella hace cuajada y crema para la venta que realiza en el mercado municipal y tambien en su casa de habitacion desde hace 17 años, nos comento que ella y su esposo se han dedicado a este tipo de negocio desde siempre y con el que han sacado adelante a sus hijos. Los prestamos le han sido de gran ayuda, ya que le han permitido realizar algunas mejoras a su casa de habitacion y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Concepcion is 50 years old, is married with four dependents and lives in a community 70km away called Larreynaga. It is worth mentioning that she owns cattle and makes curd and cream from their milk which she has been selling in the municipal market and also from her home for the last seventeen years. She tells us that she and her husband have always made their living in this business and it is how they have supported their children. The loans have been a great help since they have allowed them to make some improvements to their home and in that way improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement and sand) and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La señora flor es habitante del municipio de chichigalpa es casada tiene 3 hijos menores de edad solo uno en edad escolar ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de verduras desde hace 3 años ubicada en el mercado municipal de chichigalpa es una mujer emprendedora su día de trabajo inicia dese las 6 de la mañana y finaliza a las 4:00 de la tarde la señora solicito el crédito para invertir en su negocio y poder hacerlo crecer un poco más.

Es una mujer que le gusta el trabajo ella tiene deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Ms. Flor lives in the Chichigalpa municipality and is married with three young children. Only one is of school-age. She has a small store that has sold vegetables for 3 years, which is located in the local market in Chichigalpa. Flor is an entrepreneurial woman, and her work day begins at 6 in the morning and doesn't conclude until 4 in the afternoon. She is seeking this loan to invest in her business and be able to help it grow a bit more. 

She enjoys her work, and she has hopes to continue improving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mileni

texts.es: La señora Mileni  es una persona trabajadora y responsable, proviene de una familia humilde y unida, actualmente tiene a su cargo dos hijos pequeños de seis y un año de edad, el hijo más pequeño comenzara la etapa escolar y esto aumento la necesidad de ingresos para su familia. Vive en la casa de sus padres en la provincia Quillacollo. Tiene veintidós años, es madre soltera y desea otorgarles a sus hijos todas las oportunidades que ella no tuvo,  ellos son el motivo por el que ella quiere salir hacia adelante, buscando mejores oportunidades para su familia. La señora tiene una tienda en un colegio que está ubicado por la zona donde vive, solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería para tener mayor variedad y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, con esto generara más ingresos para su familia, y podrá mejorar las condiciones en las que vive.
texts.en:
Mileni is a hard working and responsible person, raising a humble and close-knit family. Currently, she has two small children in her care, who are 6 and 1 years old. Her son will soon begin school, and this increases her family's need for income. 

Mileni lives in her parent's house in the Quillacollo province. She is 22 years old, is a single mother, and wishes to provide her children all the opportunities she never had. They are the reason why she wants to continue moving forward and searching for better opportunities for her family. She has a store in a school that is located in the zone where she lives, and is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to have a wider variety of products and satisfy her customer's needs. With this, Mileni will be able to generate more income for her family and improve the conditions they live in.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 34 years old and married with three children.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries and school supplies to offer for resale.

She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns income from farming sugarcane.

Mary Grace aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and school supplies to offer for resale.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 52 years old, and married with nine children. Three of her children are in school.
