Sylvia is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sylvia requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF, in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Sylvia has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Reylen

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Reylene works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling food. Reylene is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF, in order to buy more groceries for resale, such as canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee.

Reylene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for resale, such as canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadya lives in Tsater village with her husband, parents-in-law and two children. Nadya works at a local school as a cleaner and her husband is a driver. The couple is also involved in farming. They keep cows, calves and piglets, and also cultivate wheat and potatoes and have apricot, cherry and plum trees. 

Nadya has requested this loan of 3,000 USD to be able to purchase seven piglets, feed for the livestock, and fertilizer for land cultivation. She hopes to expand her family's farm and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for seven piglets, feed for the livestock, and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Nooreen

texts.en: Nooreen is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of selling milk with her husband for the past five years. She has one buffalo, which she uses for selling milk to the people of her village. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra profits. Nooreen has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Nooreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra has successfully built her hand embroidery business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now, she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with pack of sequins, beads, and pearls. 

This will enable her to cater to more customers to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of sequins, beads, and pearls.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been running a beauty parlor business for about nine years. 

She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Parveen needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this reason, she requires hair rollers, combs, and hair care products along with bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation.  

She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. Parveen is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair rollers, combs, and hair care products along with bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Ana solicita cada 3 meses crédito para la compra de materia prima como vasos descarta bles, cucha ritas, arroz, azúcar, por mayor y para realizar algunas mejoras en su casa de habitación en este crédito otorgado ella realizo la compra de materiales para la división de dos cuartos para sus hijos.

la señora Ana es una mujer luchadora con deseo de superación.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a loan for 3 months to buy general supplies, such as disposable cups, small spoons, rice, and sugar, for the most part. She would like to carry out some improvements in her home, and with the blessing of a previous loan she was able to buy materials to divide two room for her children. 

Ana is a hard working woman with the desire to keep improving.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, disposable cups and spoons and "Arroz Faisan" (a brand-name long-grain rice).

loans.name: Dwi

texts.en:
Dwi runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and snacks. He lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. Dwi is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Dwi began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Pilar Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Pilar es habitante de chichigalpa es madre soltera tiene 2 hijas una en edad escolar cuenta con un pequeño negocio de bolsas plásticas desde hace 16 años es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja fuerte para mantener  a sus dos hijas ya que ella no recibe apoyo de otras personas.

la señora pilar utiliza el préstamo para invertir en su negocio y para realizar mejoras en su vivienda para brindarle una mejor vida a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Pilar lives in Chichigalpa and is a single mother to two school-aged daughters. She counts on a small store where she has sold plastic bags for the past 16 years. She is an entrepreneurial woman who works hard to take care of her two daughters, since she does not receive support from others. 

Pilar will use the loan to invest in her business and carry out improvements to her home, in order to provide a better life for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.en:
Kurbongul was born in 1986. She lives in the southern part of Tajikistan. She is divorced and is bringing up two children. Her children are little. 

Kurbongul is the only provider for her family. She began her own business with animal husbandry five years ago. She feeds cows. 

Now, she has two milk cows. She sells milk and milk products to local people. Kurbongul has her regular customers. 

She wants to provide her children with better living conditions. She is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cattle for increasing working capital. 

Kurbongul awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. 

She has been doing this for the past seven years. She knows very well  the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Shahida earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons, and laces to meet with the increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons, and laces.

loans.name: Yerr

texts.en:
A loan of 3,600 helps Yerr buy TerraClear water filters that he can resell to his community.

Mr. Yerr is a 26 year old man from the high plateau of Northern Laos.  His home is very near the fabled Plain of Jars.  Despite living in some of the most beautiful mountains and surrounded by lush vegetation Yerr's community and the surrounding province face a daily challenge in finding clean water to drink.  Most villagers are forced to head to a nearby stream or haul contaminated water from a shallow well to their homes.  If they boil to treat contaminated water it requires a significant amount of time and fuel.  By selling water filters, Yerr helps his community overcome the problem of contaminated drinking water.  Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter!  Yerr is a change agent and is doing his part; he often travels up to 100km per day to sell approximately 20 water filters per month.  One water filter in a home provides clean drinking water to an average of 5.8 people; consequently, Mr Yerr can provide clean water to over 100 people each month. He enjoys the opportunity to give families an inexpensive way to generate clean drinking water.   Yerr earns a small commission on the sale of each water filter, which he is saving up so he can marry his sweetheart.

loans.use: to purchase the TerraClear water filter so he can sell them and provide families an efficient way to generate clean drinking water in their homes.

loans.name: Phumee

texts.en: Mr. Phumee is 36 years old and has one wife and three children between the ages of 17 and 6 months. He is the village chief for his village, but is also a sticky rice farmer and he raises livestock.  His village takes water from a well and from the local streams.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.  Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases.  Mr. Phumee earns a small commission from the sale of each water filter, which he will use to care for his children and to send each of them to school. Mr. Phumee is expecting to sell 20 filters each month; providing clean water to an average of 100 people each month. Mr. Phumee is very enthusiastic about the opportunity to help his neighbors and fellow villagers improve their health through the provision of uncontaminated water.

loans.use: to purchase water filters so he then can sell them to his fellow villagers.

loans.name: Khamee

texts.en:
Mr. Khamee is 58 years old and has a wife and seven children that range in age from 32 to 16 years old. Mr. Khamee works very hard to provide for his family – he is a sticky rice farmer and raises some livestock in addition to selling water filters. 

Mr. Khamee’s village uses spring water but the water is unsuitable to drink. The nearby villages use surface water like shallow wells but, like his own village, the water in these places is contaminated with bacteria and other water spread disease.  Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter that is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases.

Mr. Khamee is expecting to sell approximately 20 filters each month; providing clean water to an average of 100 people per month. He will make a small commission from the sale of each water filter; the commission helps him send his children to school and provide for his family’s needs.  Mr. Khamee is encouraged by how the filter helps provide clean water, assist villagers improve their overall health, and how it helps provide additional income for his wife and family.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can sell them in nearby villages.

loans.name: Talat

texts.en:
Talat is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has four years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, grains, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, grains, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Shammah

texts.en:
Shammah has successfully built her tailoring business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. 

This will allow her to stitch more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy roof supports to complete the roof of her home.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is a 46-year-old married woman and has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow in milk and sells the milk to many of her neighbors. She also sells butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  

She performs the task of collecting milk, and her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. 

They need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and health. In order to make bigger profits, Hasina requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more cow. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history. She expects a boost in her net income through larger sales.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de 38 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta segundo grado ya que no pudo continuar sus estudios por problemas económicos, esta casada y es madre de tres hijos de 21, 17 y 12 años de edad de los cuales uno estudia el bachillerato y uno estudia quinto grado, mientras que el tercer hijo le ayuda en la crianza de animales. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, mientras que ella se dedica a la venta de queso desde hace 6 años, pues a medida fue incrementando los animales sus ventas fueron aumentando y sus ingresos también para darles una mejor alimentación a sus hijos, María trabaja en el horario de 6:00 am a 11:00 am.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar arena, cemento, grava, madera,  para mejorar su vivienda, ya que en el invierno su familia y ella se mojan.

Los sueños de María es llegar a tener 30 vacas, pagar su crédito sin ningun inconveniente para seguir trabajando con la institución y ayudar a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales de bien.
texts.en:
María, 38, is a homemaker.  She studied up to second grade but couldn't continue because of financial problems.  She's married and the mother of three children, ages 21, 17, and 12.  One of her children is studying for his diploma and one is in fifth grade; the third one helps her raise animals.

Her husband works in construction, while she has earned a living selling cheese for six years.  When she got more animals, her sales and her income increased, so she gave her children better nourishment.  María works from 6 a.m. until 11 a.m.

The loan she's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy sand, cement, gravel, and wood to improve her home, because in the winter she and her family get wet.

María's dreams are to have 30 cows, to pay back her loan without any problems so she can continue working with the institution, and to help her children be decent professionals.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, and wood

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at her house. She has fifteen years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of eight children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, sugar, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, sugar, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Esperanza  De Vida Con El Futuro Group

texts.es: Noemí  de 37 años de edad es separada. El grupo “Esperanza de Vida” está conformado por 09 socios optimistas y emprendedores. Noemí se dedica a la venta de reposterías como pasteles y tortas. Ella tiene el anhelo de continuar creciendo en su negocio ya que así puede cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de queques, tortas y pasteles. El grupo “Esperanza de Vida” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Noemí se ubica en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado derecho, viste chompa marrón.
texts.en:
Noemi, 37 years old, is separated. The Esperanza De Vida group is made up  of 9 optimistic and enterprising partners. Noemi makes a living selling baked goods like tarts and pies. She has the desire to continue growing in her business because that way she can cover household expenses.

She requested the loan to buy cakes, pies, and tarts.

The Esperanza De Vida group thanks the Kiva investors for providing this loan. Noemi is located in the back. She is the third from the right side. She is wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use: to buy cakes, pies, and tarts.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Since the introduction of the Indian motorcycle as a mode of public transportation in Kenya, motorcycle usage is easily the leading method used by rural farmers to transport produce and farm supplies. This is attributed to success in accessing areas with no roads, as well as low fuel consumption, low maintenance costs and high flexibility.

Raymond is a dairy farmer in Kapsowar, which is in the county where many world-champion marathon runners in Kenya come from. He has been doing dairy farming for five years and selling milk to provide for his family of two children. 

Over the years, he has had challenges in transporting milk to the market. He decided to purchase a motorcycle. It did not take long before he started reaping the benefits of this purchase. His work was made much easier and soon he turned it into a business. 

Today, Raymond is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle. He is going to employ a person to help him with offering transportation solutions to members of his village. 

Your loan, along with that of other lenders, which supports improved transportation in rural areas will encourage farmers to increase production, add value to their products, reduce spoilage and waste, and empower the farmers, as well as have a positive impact on their productivity, income and employment.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for farm transportation.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 40-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availabile funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Erick, a farmer in Molo, Kenya. Erick has a wife and two children. For the past four years, Erick’s primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and transportation services.

He is most passionate about dairy farming: income from milk is significant and comes regularly. His biggest challenge has been transporting milk to the market, due to poor transport and a poor road network. He decided to purchase a motorcycle for easy market accessibility and mobility. As farmers kept approaching Erick to provide transportation services, this grew into a business that solved a challenge many farmers were facing. The motorcycle made work much easier, cheaper and convenient for farmers. 

Erick is seeking a loan to purchase another motorcycle. He will use the money generated from this asset to repay the loan and improve his family’s standard of living.
 
Your loan will empower farmers, as well as have a positive impact on their productivity, income, employment and poverty alleviation in the rural areas, since motorcycles make it easier to move supplies and workers to the farms, as well as products to markets and agro-allied industries

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for farm transportation.

loans.name: Mariela Eunice

texts.es:
Un olor exquisito de comida nicaragüense se desprende del comedor de Mariela, no hay persona que se resista a los platillos que se ofrecen. Es una joven dinámica y emprendedora, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Hace dos años tomó una de las decisiones más importantes de su vida, manejar el negocio que su padre que había puesto en marcha hace 20 años; lo que ha sido todo un reto, pero poco a poco ha salido adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de una cocina de carbón y así lograr aumentar la producción de su trabajo. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que logrará vender otro servicio como lo es la venta de carne asada, pollo asado y cerdo asado. Con el apoyo de su familia planea seguir creciendo, su meta es terminar de estudiar y consolidar el negocio, desea brindarle a su clientela una atención de calidad, como lo hacía su papá.
texts.en:
An exquisite smell of Nicaraguan food is emitted from Mariela’s diner. No person can resist the dishes that are offered. She is a dynamic, entrepreneurial, young woman. She is 24 years old, single and without children. Two years ago she made one of the most important decisions of her life: to manage a business that her father had not opened for 20 years.  This has been a big challenge, but little by little she has moved forward. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase a coal kitchen stove, and thus increase the production of her work. She places her trust in this financing because she will be able to provide other services, such as selling roasted meat, roasted chicken, and roasted pork. With her family’s support she plans to keep growing. 

Her goal is to finish studying and consolidate the business. She wishes to give her customers quality care, like her father used to do.

loans.use: to purchase a coal kitchen stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods, such as flour, oil, and red-oil, for making bread.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, cooking oil, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a town and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the loan and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Lunahuana junto a su familia.
Estudió la carrera de Corte y Confección. actualmente trabaja como Personal de Limpieza en una prestigiosa empresa de la zona donde vive. Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, respetuosa y amable.
Liz está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un juego de dormitorio para poder sentirse más cómoda y dormir mejor. así ella seguirá esforzándose para cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su propio negocio"
texts.en:
Liz is a hard working, 38 year-old woman. She is single and lives in Lunahuana with her family. 

She studied dressmaking. Currently, Liz works as a member of the cleaning staff at a prestigious company in the zone where she lives. It is going very well for her because she is a very responsible, respectful, and well-natured person. 

Liz is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support, she will be able to buy a bedroom set to be feel more comfortable at home and sleep better. For this, she will continue building strength in order to carry out her biggest dream: having her own business.

loans.use: to buy a furniture set for her bedroom.

loans.name: Bengift

texts.en: Bengift is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more milk for resale. He hopes that in the future, he will increase his income and improve the family's well-being. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin is 35 years old and married. He has two children. Both of his children go to secondary school. His wife is a housewife. The family is living in the Baki region, but they are IDPs (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city over 21 years ago. Elchin has a store. In the store, Elchin sells daily food products. He has been selling products for 10 years. Elchin has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1300 AZN to support his business. He is planning to buy more products for selling with this amount. Elchin says, “Thanks dear Kiva organization and lenders, I hope that, this loan will help to develop the business.”

loans.use: to pay for more products for selling.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy and competitive place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour and cooking oil for preparing food. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children to the highest level. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking oil for preparing food.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is single with three children and all go to school. She takes care of two additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: Amna is a 44-year-old married woman, doing business selling animals with her husband for many years. At present, she has 1 cow and 1 buffalo.  Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She has 4 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food, heath and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history. Currently, she applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Jonan

texts.en: Jonan is a 30-year-old single male with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Jonan operates an electronics shop, which he has been operating since 2010. He earns a salary as additional income. Jonan started the business to earn a living. He is a hard working man and is hoping to expand his business and have a stable income in order to achieve his dreams. Jonan is requesting a loan to buy radios and other electronics to sell.

loans.use: to buy radios and other electronics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 42-year-old married woman. She has four children. She is in the business of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to develop a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful of increasing her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: At the age of 49, Mumtaz is a hardworking, married woman. She has 8 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a restaurant where he cooks food for selling. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a suitable location and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the fact that food goes bad easily. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food to sell. His business goal is to have an executive hotel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: buy more ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Agricultural production is very important to the economy of developing nations, including Kenya. It is the major occupation of the inhabitants, providing employment directly or indirectly for at least 75% of the people. This writing draws your attention to Catherine who relies on the dairy cow and poultry she keeps to make a living.
 
Catherine, 38, is a hardworking and committed mother of 3. She is a smallholder farmer in Molo, who has been practicing dairy farming for 6 years now. She also keeps poultry and grows vegetables for subsistence.

There is a huge potential market for vegetables in Molo. The only challenge is that they are not as profitable since they are seasonal. Either there is a surplus leading to low prices or a shortage leading to high prices.

Catherine is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a greenhouse. When she has a greenhouse, she effectively will have her own little micro-environment that she can control. With your loan, Catherine will become the God of her own little patch of land! She will determine and set conditions that are conducive for her crops to grow healthy and strong.

The profits from the greenhouse will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth and efficiency. The overall plan behind this whole project is to increase her income and improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright is 37 years old. He is a married, Ugandan male with four children. He runs a poultry farm as his business and he is also involved in tailoring and design from where he gets his additional income. The motive for joining the business world was to develop and sustain himself. Bright needs a loan to buy chicken feeds and feeding troughs for his poultry. His dream is to educate his children. Defaulters and delay in payment are the challenges affecting his performance.

loans.use: to buy chicken feeds and feeding troughs for his poultry.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran, age 32, is a married woman.  She deals in business, selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market, at higher prices. She makes enough money through her business to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Sughran needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her fourth  loan cycle, with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Kenya is an agrarian nation. Most goods to be transported are agricultural products, which are by their nature often bulky, low-priced and highly perishable. Logic dictates that agricultural produce must be conveyed from its area of production to the zone of consumption with minimum delay. However, the reality  is that farmers like Stanley, a father of three in Molo, incur losses due to poor roads and transport networks. Transporting produce to the market is increasingly becoming expensive and impossible for farmers in this village. 

Stanley is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle. He has been farming for seven years and selling milk and eggs from his farm in the nearby market. He realized he can make more money by transporting his produce to outside markets, which offer better prices.

With your loan, Stanley will purchase a motorcycle to access areas trucks can’t get to. The motorcycle will also provide a transportation solution to his community of farmers. He has foreseen that bad weather conditions may present a major challenge but remains positive that improving transportation will encourage farmers to work harder for increased production and reduce spoilage and wastage.

Proceeds from the business will be ploughed back to the business to increase Stanley's income and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for farm produce transportation

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a bar and works seven days a week. He has been in this business for seven months. In addition to that, he owns a transport business to earn additional income. William began the business to earn a living and is working hard to increase his capital. This is the reason he is requesting a loan to buy beers, sodas and wines to sell and suit his customers' demands despite the challenge of high license fees.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas and wines to sell.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
The role of transport to rural smallholder farmers in Kenya like Jeremiah (pictured) is very crucial. As in other businesses, transportation is a phase in the production process, which is not complete until the commodity is in the hands of the final consumers.

Jeremiah, 24, lives with his wife and child on a small piece of land in Nyamira. The region is popular for growing bananas as a staple food. Jeremiah had been engaged in farming--keeping poultry and dairy cows--for less than three years, when he saw a big gap and seized the opportunity.

The road networks in Nyamira have been terrible since time immemorial. The road situation has forced farmers to sell their produce within their environs at a low price because of surplus supply. Roads to the farm can hardly be accessed by motor vehicles. 

Jeremiah purchased an ideal Indian motorcycle with low fuel consumption, low maintenance costs and a great deal of flexibility. With this machine, he was able to transport his milk and eggs to a distant market with fair prices, as well as offer transportation services to pedestrians along the way when he was returning. 

He saw a bigger potential in helping other farmers transport their produce and sell it at a better market price. Jeremiah is seeking a loan to purchase more motorcycles. This will enable him to fill the demand for his services as well as offer employment to others in his community. 

With your loan, Jeremiah will realize his vision of offering transformational transport solutions that seek to improve agricultural productivity, enhance quality of life for farmers, create a market for agricultural produce, facilitate interaction among geographical and economic regions and open up new areas for economic focus.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycles for farm transportation

loans.name: Bruhan

texts.en:
Bruhan is a 65-year-old, hard-working, married man, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He owns a retail shop as his main source of income, alongside agriculture, where he earns an extra income. He started this business to earn a living and to look after his family. He has personal goals of expanding his business and owning a wholesale shop. His main hardships are high competition and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands. 

Bruhan is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, sweets, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, sweets, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional herbs from Harare to supply to the town of Mutare.

loans.name: Jumadi

texts.en:
Jumadi runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories. He has been running this stall for one year.  Jumadi lives in Indramayu, a semi-urban area about six hours from Jakarta.  He is married.

To increase the family income, Jumadi also works as a dealer.  He joined Ruma five months ago to increase his income and he feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. 

Jumadi is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much-needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Jumadi is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will be able to help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer to process bill payments

loans.name: Haryanto

texts.en:
Haryanto runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and groceries. He has been running this stall for two years.  Haryanto lives in Indramayu, a semi-urban area about six hours from Jakarta.  Haryanto is married.

To increase the family income, Haryanto also works as a dealer.  He joined Ruma seven months ago to increase his income and feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. 

Haryanto is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much-needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Haryanto is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will be able to help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer to process bill payments

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as determined. Rose operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a suitable location and her primary customers are local residents. She says that her biggest business challenge is that fruits go bad quickly. 

Rose will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand and serve many clients within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, palm oil and seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a hard-working female; she is married with three children and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a boutique to earn herself a living, as well as owning rentals that bring in extra income. She faces the challenge of competition but has a dream of building a permanent house.
 
She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, slippers and pure water to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and clean cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas

loans.name: Dominiko

texts.en:
Dominiko is a 40-year-old male who is married with children and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop as his main source of income, as well as engaging in agriculture where he earns extra income. He started this business with the aim of generating income and educating his children. He is affected by seasonal changes and bad debtors, but hopes to expand his business by reducing on-credit customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy more items like sugar, soap, salt and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, soap, salt and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Renzo Jesus

texts.es:
Renzo es un joven emprendedor, tiene 29 años y vive en Chincha, es soltero y vive en Chincha junto a su familia.
Tiene tres hijos quienes son su mayor inspiración en la vida y por quienes lucha constantemente para poder brindarles un futuro mejor. Desde hace varios años trabaja prestando servicios a diferentes empresas y le va muy bien porque es una persona con muchos deseos de superación, muy trabajador, responsable y honesto.
Renzo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un artefacto (refrigeradora) para poder guardar sus alimentos y que sean más duraderos, con esto mejorará su calidad de vida y podrá seguir esforzándose para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Renzo, age 29, is an enterprising young man.  He is single, and he lives in Chincha with his family.  He has three children who are the greatest inspiration in his life.  He struggles constantly to be able to give them a better future.  He has worked for several years providing services to different companies.  It is going very well for him because his is a person with a great desire to succeed.  He is very hard-working, responsible, and honest.

Renzo is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided to him he will be able to buy an appliance (refrigerator).  He will do this to be able to keep his food and so that the food lasts longer.  With this he will improve his quality of life and he will be able to continue putting forth great effort in order to get his children ahead.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Shahmar

texts.en:
Shahmar was born in 1962. He is married, with three children. One of them is studying their first course of medical college, another is going to eleventh class, and the little child, who is 14 years old, is also going to school. Shahmar’s wife is a math teacher in the same school. The family is living in the Baku region. 

Shahmar has been in the taxi driver business for 12 years. Today, he wants to repair his car’s motor and, for this reason, Shahmar has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan in the amount of AZN 700 (Azerbaijan New Manat). For your help, he says, "thanks to all lenders of Kiva organization."

loans.use: to pay for repair of his car’s motor.

loans.name: Antipa

texts.en: Antipa is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a welding business where he offers welding services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of welding items. His business goal is to own a big garage within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of welding items.

loans.use: to buy more stock of welding items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and pure water to expand her business

loans.name: Una Nueva Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Una Nueva Esperanza está formado por 7 socias que viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, parroquia que tiene una geografía accidentada con hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y también al comercio, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades. Su gente se caracteriza por su amabilidad y cordialidad, son personas de un corazón muy cálido como las socias quienes son trabajadoras y luchan día a día para mejorar su situación económica para sacar  adelante a sus familias. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora María, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada  y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años que están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo labora como empleado público, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
Doña María pasa en casa al cuidado de su familia, se dedica a la cría de cuyes, pollos, cerdos y ganado, también a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es  tener una tienda en su casa.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Una Nueva Esperanza” [The New Hope] loan group is comprised of seven members that live in the surrounding areas of Valle de Cuenca, a parish with a rugged geography and beautiful landscapes.  The inhabitants are engaged in raising animals, farming, and also business.  Many work in various businesses in the city.  The people are known for their kindness and cordiality.  They are very warm-hearted, like the hardworking group members who strive every day to improve their financial situation and get their families ahead.

One of the group members is Maria.  She is 34 years old, married, and has two children, ages 15 and 13, who are studying at the city school.  Her husband is a public employee, and they live in a relative’s home since they don’t have their own home.

Maria spends her time at home caring for her family.  She is engaged in raising guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and cattle.  She is also engaged in farming for home consumption, and sells her products if there is anything left over.  She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of chickens.  Her goal is to have a store in her home.  

The small photo is of a member that could not be present when the group photo was taken.
.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Descripción	Breve descripción del grupo y luego de una de las miembros. 
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, una zona bastante alejada de la capital del país, que está en constante crecimiento.
La Sra.  Florentina es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde  se desempeña como docente y enfermera. Por las tardes hace comestibles para vender frente a su casa, y por medio de estos trabajos lucha para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para el día a día.  Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona y sus compañeras de comité puedan ir mejorando su entorno.
Florentina pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir con la venta de sus comidas, quiere comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos, y demás, y de esa forma también poder dar a sus clientes las delicias que prepara.
texts.en:
Short description of the group and then of one of the members.

The Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank is in its fifth cycle in the women’s committee program.  It is in the city of Concepción, an area that is pretty far from the capital of the country.  It is in constant growth.

Florentina is one of the members.  She is from an area that is far from the center, the same as the city where she works as a teacher and nurse.  In the evenings she makes food to sell in front of her house.  It is through these jobs that she struggles to be able to give her family everything that they need day to day.

She hopes that as time passes, and with the help of all of the people in her area and her colleagues, they will be able to improve their environment.

Florentina requests this loan to be able to buy supplies in order to continue with her food sales.  She wants to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and the rest.  This way she will also be able to give her customers they delicacies that she prepares.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and the rest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and mayonnaise to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wine, beer, soda and other drinks.

loans.name: Upendo Women Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of 5 women who are in different kinds of business such as selling of second hand clothes, kitchen ware, rearing of poultry and selling of building materials. The group leader is 52 yrs old  has 5 children aged between 22yrs and 28 months. The women live in Komarock area within Nairobi and they have been using the traditional cook stove for cooking. With traditional cook stoves, there is a lot of Indoor Air Pollution (IAP)which leads to respiratory diseases and also there is a lot of charcoal consumption by the traditional stoves.

Currently on average each member spends USD1.3 on charcoal everyday. The loan will enable them purchase high efficient cook stoves- ECO ZOOM that will save them up to 50% of their daily consumption on charcoal. These cook stoves also reduce smoke and carbon emissions from the charcoal thus creating a better and cleaner environment for their families.

The families will be able to save USD 0.65 daily from the reduced consumption on charcoal.  This translates to USD234 every year for at least 5 years (lifetime of the cook stove).  This money will be saved and used for other needs like paying for their children's school fees, paying rent and making their lives better.

loans.use: To pay for high efficient improved cook stove

loans.name: Virgen Del Lujan Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Lujan está en su cuarto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, a través de la cual podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de ellas es la señora Casilda, quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco más y trabajar. Ella se dedica a la  venta de comidas que ella misma hace, y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora.
Casilda pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas que gustan mucho a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Lujan communal bank is in its fourth cycle of the women’s committee program.  All of them have pledged to work and help each other to get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey.  Through the survey they will be able to learn about the life situation of each one of them.

Casilda is one of them.  In the survey she scored a poverty level of one.  The means that she has to put forth a little more effort and work.  She sells food that she makes herself.  She then goes out to sell it in an itinerant manner.  She is a very selfless and tenacious person.

She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, and other supplies.  She will do this in order to be able to continue making the food that her customers like so much.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, and other supplies.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El  Sr. Osvaldo es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 34 años, está casado con la Sra. Zoraida de 33 años, tiene un hijo, quien es el motivo de lucha de la pareja.
Él se dedica a la producción y venta de leche, que desde muy tempranas horas del día sale a vender para que sus clientes tengan su producto para el desayuno. Es una persona muy sacrificada que se esfuerza por su familia, para darles un futuro digno.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar una vaca lechera, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con la producción de leche para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Señor Osvaldo is from the city of Santaní. He is 34 years old and married to Señora Zoraida, who is 33 years old. They have one son, who is the couple's motivation.

Osvaldo earns his living producing and selling milk. Starting very early in the day, he goes out to sell so that his customers will have his product in time for breakfast. He is a very selfless person who works hard for his family in order to give them a worthy future. 

He is asking for this loan so that he can buy a milk cow. This will enable him to continue with the production of milk to sell. He is grateful for the opportunity for growth that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Maximino

texts.en:
Maximino lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is a farmer (potato and corn), age 46 years who lives with his wife and three children, his wife is a farmer too, and they work together. It is clear that Maximino works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   
The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  He mentioned that hopes the solar energy system it will assist production activities in the home and to improve living conditions for his family, and assisting their economy and the family health. Maximino is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras

loans.use: To purchase a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Mujeres Dinámicas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres Dinámicas, está en su ciclo número 13, es un grupo que viene trabajando de manera activa, son reconocidas por su unión y por ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir, que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de capacitaciones y verificaciones y sumado a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia y demás seres queridos. Su sueño es poder tener su propio negocio de comidas y no vender más de manera ambulante.
La Sra. Solicita este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y demás insumos. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo, y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Dinámicas. It´s in its 13th cycle. It is a group that has been working actively. They are recognized for working together and for helping one another.

One of the members is Mrs. María, who, in her last survey, demonstrated a level of poverty within level three. This means that through effort and continuous work, and through training and verifications, on top of the sale of food that she makes herself, she is moving forward and helps her family and the rest of her loved ones. Her dream is to be able to have her own food business and to not sell as a street vendor.

This woman is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of several goods to be able to keep making her foods, such as vegetables, condiments, and other goods. She is grateful for the opportunity that her and her friends are receiving, it will help a lot.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, and other goods.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Stanley, a married father of two children aged three and five years. In 2011, Stanley established his stationary and photocopying shop business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about Le1,000,000 every month. 

Stanley is requesting a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000 to buy more books, pencils, pens, etc. for resale. Very hard working, in the future he plans to open another shop to earn more profit.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more books, pencils, pens, etc. for resale

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Señor Alfredo es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene hijos,  por quienes está luchando en su negocio de despensa y de carnicería, es una persona trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta.
Empezó a trabajar con un pequeño kiosko ventas de comidas rápidas, su sueño de siempre era de tener una despensa con productos bien surtidos y una carnicería para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ahora ya cuenta con su propio negocio  con clientela formada, que gracias a su esfuerzo se fue formando.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas, frutas, verduras, lácteos y demás insumos para poder surtir su despensa, y de esa forma seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
Alfredo is from the city of Santaní, and has three children for whom he is striving in his grocery store and butcher shop.   He is hardworking, responsible, and honest.  He started working with a small kiosk, selling fast food.  His life long dream was to have a grocery store, well-stocked with products, and a butcher shop to be able to meet customer demand.  Now, he already has his own business with a customer base, which was formed thanks to his effort.  He is requesting this loan to purchase drinks, fruits, vegetables, dairy products, and other supplies that will enable him to stock his grocery store and, in this way, continue giving his customers what they request.
.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, fruits, vegetables, dairy products, and other supplies for his grocery store.

loans.name: Masauso

texts.en:
Masauso is 30 years old and has 2 children in Nyimba District, Zambia. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his vegetable crops.

Masauso grows potatoes, onions, cabbage and a local eggplant called “impwa” on his small farm. He sells his produce at local markets in Nyimba district, and last season he used his profits to buy iron sheets for his house and also paid school fees for his children. Currently he irrigates his crops by drawing water from a nearby river. He plans to get a water pump so that he can expand his production and reduce the amount of labour required.

Rent to Own has completed a seasonal business plan with Masauso, and will deliver the water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own will also provide training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and provide on-going support until his loan is complete.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is a farmer (corn and vegetables), age 24 years, He is single and lives with his mother, it is clear that Manuel works hard to maintain his mother and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   
The family currently illuminates his home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  He mentioned that hopes that, with the solar energy system will improve living conditions for his mother, and assisting production activities in the home, and assisting their economy and the family health. Manuel is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras

loans.use: To purchase a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jackets and blankets for resale

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a business friendly area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Née en 1955, Afi est veuve avec  deux(02) enfants en charge. Résident au quartier Tokoin, elle est dans  le commerce des friperies depuis 1984. Elle s’approvisionne alors à Hedzranawoé et effectue sa vente à la devanture de son domicile.
Elle sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce et avoir plus de bénéfices pour pouvoir s’occuper de ses enfants en charge.
texts.en:
Born in 1955, Afi is a widow with two dependent children. She lives in the Tokoin district.

She has been selling used clothing since 1984. She procures her goods in Hedzranawoé and sells from the front of her house.

She is requesting a loan to grow her business and generate higher profits, so that she will be able to take care of the children she supports.

loans.use: to buy one bundle of bedsheets and one of kitchen towels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of clothing such as shoes, jeans, and shirts.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es: Josefina es una señora muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 22 años, ella tiene 14 hijos y dice que mediante su negocio y mediante los ingresos de su esposo que se dedica al jornal han podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en verduras para venderlas en las ferias de las ciudades donde se transporta a vender su producto Josefina, ella aspira seguir adelante en su negocio para seguir apoyando a sus 5 hijos que aun viven con ella y a sus 3 nietos a los que los cuida y apoya en la educacion.
texts.en: Josefina is a hardworking woman who has been engaged in selling vegetables for twenty-two years.  She has fourteen children and says that through her business and her husband’s income (he is a day worker), she has been able to get her children ahead.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of vegetables, which she will transport to the city market to sell.  Josefina wishes to continue forward with her business and continue supporting her five children that still live with her as well as her three grandchildren that she cares for and supports in their education.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hair dyes, hand cream, lotions, perfume for ladies and men, make-up compacts, blush, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a wife, a mother of four, a farmer and a member of Teriki Self-Help Group in Kapsowar, Kenya. She is very active in running her farm as well as the day to day activities of the group.  She has 17 years of experience in farming! 

Over the years, she has always enjoyed dairy farming the most because of the regular income generated. “Cows have sustained my family for all these years,” she said. She would like to buy more cows, but raising money to do so is a big challenge for her.

Juhudi Kilimo is a microfinance field partner that works with partners such as Kiva to afford marginal farmers access financial to services that they can otherwise not get because of the loan requirements. Mary is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a dairy cow. The cow is expected to produce 15 litres of milk or more daily. The income she projects from this venture will enable her to fully repay the loan and save extra money. Her family’s diet will also improve as a result of the increased milk production.

The increased income will relieve the burden of high farm-related expenses from her shoulders. And her family will have enough food as a benefit from your lending.

loans.use: o purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are of all types. 

Grace describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and beauty products for use in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cothes and footwear

loans.name: Kitumba Binanata B Windows & Orphans Assoc. Group

texts.en:
Hillary, aged 60, is a married Ugandan man with eight children, with only three attending school. His major occupation is carpentry but he also supplements it with both animal and food crop farming from which he gets more income to support his family. 

Hillary needs a loan to buy timber for making furniture. His future hope is expanding his carpentry workshop so that he can produce a variety of furniture for his clients and retain them which will help him improve in both income and profit levels. What affects him most are the rental and license fees which have constantly made him lag behind in the business arena.

loans.use: to buy timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Francisco Lenin

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 33 años y está a punto de convertirse en Licenciado en Biología Química. Sin embargo, a pesar de haberse levantado todos los sábados hace 5 años, sin dejar a parte su trabajo como docente de educación secundaria y de agricultor, tiene la posibilidad de no obtener su título como licenciado debido a sus limitaciones económicas. Pero sus sueños no terminan ahí, la motivación de su hijo de un año y la de su pareja, lo han hecho salir adelante y buscar opciones. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su padre, quien es caficultor, y de su madre, quien es una maestra de educación jubilada.
Por consiguiente, solicita de un préstamo para cubrir los gastos de titulación y graduación. Francisco se siente realizado con su profesión, ya que a diario la aplica en sus trabajos. Con este título lo acreditará como Licenciado en Biología Química, lo cual le permitirá en optar por mejores ofertas laborales. Entre sus planes está conseguir un mejor empleo que genere mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 33 years old and is on the cusp of earning his degree in biochemistry. However, even though he got up every Saturday for five years and did not quit his job as a secondary educator and farmer, there is a possibility that he will not get his degree due to economic limitations. His dreams don't stop there, though. The motivation of his one-year-old son and his wife have made him get ahead and look for options. Fortunately, he has his father's, who is a coffee-grower, support, as well as that of his mother, who is a retired schoolteacher.

Therefore, he is requesting a loan to cover the costs of schooling and graduation. Francisco feels he is already a professional since he applies his learning on a daily basis at work. With the degree, he will be accredited as having graduated with a degree in biochemistry. This will allow him to go for better job offers. Among his plans are to pursue a better job that will pay better wages.

loans.use: to cover schooling and graduation costs.

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es: Ligia es madre soltera, vive con una de sus  2 hijos, comenta que vive en una casa que en su mayoría fue financiada por el bono que le dio gobierno ecuatoriano,  Ligia trabaja en la cuadrilla y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, que los cría en unos lotes que son propiedad del Municipio de la ciudad donde reside Ligia, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chonchos para seguir adelante con su negocio por medio del que aspira curarse de una enfermedad que padece en  su pierna que no la deja caminar normalmente.
texts.en: Ligia is a single mother, and lives with one of her two children.  She says that she lives in a house that was funded mostly by a bond that the Ecuadorian government gave her.  Ligia works with a crew, and also raises small animals on some lots owned by the municipality of the city where she lives.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs to continue forward with her business.  In this way, she hopes to cure a condition in her leg that she suffers, which doesn’t permit her to walk normally.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as soft drinks, water and grand nuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase merchandise (household appliances) to run her business.

loans.name: Jesus Isabel

texts.es:
Jesus es una joven emprendedora, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Imperial junto a su familia.
Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Repostería y desde hace casi 2 años se dedica a la venta de pasteles frente a un Colegio, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de excelente calidad a un precio cómodo.
Jesus está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar vitrinas para colocar sus pasteles y también comprará insumos para prepararlos. Con esto ella incrementará sus ventas y obtendrá mayores ingresos, de esta manera más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener un local propio".
texts.en:
Jesus is an enterprising young lady. She is 19 years old, single, and lives in Imperial with her family. She is currently studying pastry-making, and for almost two years, she has made a living selling pastries outside a school. Things are going very well for her because she is a very responsible, hardworking and honest person, and above all, because she offers products of excellent quality at a good price.

Jesus is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support she will be able to buy display cases for her pastries and ingredients to make her pastries. With this support, she will increase her sales and earn more income, enabling her to one day realize her biggest dream: "to have her own shop".

loans.use: to buy display cases and ingredients for her pastry sales business.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Bwanika Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of Bwanika Tukwatanize Group. He is 49 years old, married with 6 children between the ages of 29 and 8 years, and 3 of them are in school. He sells fish as his business and generates additional income, which is used to educate his children, by raising cattle. 

He needs a loan to buy more fish to increase his stock which will lead to the generation of higher income, thus increased profits. He has a number of dreams to achieve and they include buying his personal car and building a permanent house. Lack of preservation methods are a major threat to his business, as he deals in a perishable product.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Kiryantama United Group

texts.en: Mary, a member of Kiryantama United group, is a hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in selling produce like maize, cassava flour and fresh foods like tomatoes and potatoes. She faces challenges of price fluctuation. Besides that, she hopes to have enough stock and to educate her children to higher levels of learning. Mary will use the loan to buy bananas, tomatoes, maize flour and cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes, maize flour and cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es: A sus 33 años de edad Rosa es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y aveces se va al jornal, su esposo se dedica a trabajos de albañileria en lugares muy lejanos por lo que tiene que ausentarse por algun tiempo para terminar las obras que le pongan, mientras que el esposo de Rosa se ausenta ella se hace cargo de los gastos de sus hijos y para eso va a invertir el credito en la compra de chanchos para ampliar su negocio y poder darles a sus hijos lo mas necesario.
texts.en: Rosa, 33, is married and has six children, three of whom are students. She is engaged in raising small animals and sometimes works as a day laborer.  Her husband is a bricklayer, and works in very distant places where he is away for some time completing the work he is given.  While her husband is away, Rosa takes care of her children’s expenses and for this reason, she is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs to grow her business and be able to provide her children with the most important things.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ladies' blouses, jeans, and sandals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of electronics items like cables, light fans, plugs, bulbs, radios and switches.

loans.name: Dúo Balles Del Sargento Group

texts.es:
Dúo Balles Del Sargento
Dúo formado por María Gloria Florinda de 63 años de edad  María Gloria se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la elaboración de tejidos típicos, la señora es responsable y no tiene crédito en otras institucion y cuenta que está cumpliendo sus metas de tener más material para trabajar y así surtir mas su negocio y por lo consiguiente tener más ganancias. Está agradecida por la ayuda que están recibiendo de kiva, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos para la venta.
texts.en:
Dúo Balles Del Sargento.

This pair includes María Gloria Florinda, 63.  María Gloria has worked for over five years making traditional weavings.  She is responsible and she does not have outstanding loans with other institutions.  She tells us that she is reaching her goals of having more material to work with so that she can stock her business more and generate greater earnings.  She is grateful for the help that she is receiving from Kiva.  She is seeking a loan to purchase raw material to make traditional weavings to sell.

loans.use: purchase raw material to make and sell traditional weavings.

loans.name: Kihondo Women Group

texts.en: Patrick is a 28-year-old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda, He is a member of the Kihondo Women Group, and is actively involved in transporting, farming and selling fresh foods. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital; however, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Patrick needs a loan to buy fresh foods for selling.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for selling.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Hello world!  Meet Rebecca, age 34. This mother of 1 is a resident of Kapsowar village in the North Rift region of Kenya. She is a smallholder farmer who has been engaged in mixed farming for 15 years!  She keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows tea and other greens. She also engages in other personal businesses to make extra income.
 
Rebecca is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The additional cow will increase milk production and sales volume. Quality grade cows produce up to 20 litres daily in this region. Income generated from selling that volume of milk is enough to always repay the loan’s installments on time. 

The dairy industry in Kenya has a recognized potential to generate higher income and transform living standards if appropriate interventions are developed and implemented. It also contributes significantly to food security and employment.

For Rebecca to become competitive and attain the vast potential, she requires training to handle emerging issues. Juhudi has an extension officer at Rebecca’s disposal for all the technical guidance and training programs. This will ensure she employs the best practices in dairy farming to guarantee success. She plans to spend the proceeds back into the dairy business. With your help, her family will enjoy financial security from this venture.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Salvador Emilio

texts.es:
