Candados colocados por orden de tamaño, controles de televisores de diferentes marcas se cubren bajo envolturas de colores rosados y verdes, bombillos de distintos estilos, entre otros productos, arreglan la ferretería de Salvador, un comerciante de 61 años, quien se ha mantenido a la vanguardia en los productos del hogar gracias a un préstamo anterior de MiCrédito-KIVA, donde compró anteojos, hebillas, desarmadores, correas, etcétera para mejorar su negocio. 
Padre de 3 hijos, de los cuales está a cargo junto a su pareja y quienes lo apoyan siempre en el negocio familiar. Salvador tiene un nivel académico de secundaria, es comerciante por 18 años y posee un espíritu emprendedor que lo ha llevado lejos. No obstante, piensa que es momento de volver a invertir en su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería: controles de televisión, baterías, cables, anteojos, entre otros objetos que le permitirán incrementar su inventario, seguir ofreciendo los mejores productos y complaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes. Su meta es seguir trabajando fuerte y proporcionando un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Padlocks hung in order of size, different brands of TV remote controls wrapped in red and green packaging, different types of light bulbs, and other products festoon Salvador's hardware store. Salvador is a 61-year-old businessman who has stayed on the cutting edge of household products, thanks to an earlier loan from Kiva partner MiCredito. With the earlier loan, he purchased eyeglasses, buckles, screwdrivers, belts, etc. to improve his business.

He is the father of three children whom he takes care of with his wife and who always help him with the family business. Salvador has a secondary school education. He has been a businessman for 18 years and has an entrepreneurial spirit that has taken him far. Nevertheless, he thinks that the time has come to invest in his business, which is why he is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise: TV remote controls, batteries, cables, eyeglasses, etc. This will allow him to grow his inventory to continue offering the best products and meeting the needs of his customers. His goal is to continue working hard and providing the best service.

loans.use: to purchase TV remote controls, batteries, cables, eyeglasses, etc.

loans.name: Maria Emma

texts.es: Con 62 años de edad Enma es una señora divorciada y tiene 10 hijos de las cuales solamente una vive con Enma ya que los demás ya trabajan, comenta Enma que es muy duro sacar adelante  sola a 10 hijos pero que ella lucho y pudo hacerlo, Enma se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también se va a trabajar en la cuadrilla, Enma va a invertir el crédito comprando chanchos, ella vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo y aspira seguir adelante en su negocio para cubrir los gastos que tiene diariamente
texts.en: Emma is a 62-year-old divorced woman. She lives in a house she is renting with one of her children, and has nine other children who are already working. Emma says it was very hard raising 10 children alone, but she fought and was able to do it. Emma works raising small animals and also works on a crew. Emma will use the loan to buy pigs. She aspires to move her business forward to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, coal and red-oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking seasonings, milk and mayonnaise to expand her business.

loans.name: Enyi Lorena

texts.es:
Todos los días, antes de abrir las puertas de su pulpería, Enyi con mucho ánimo y entusiasmo, limpia y ordena cada producto. El cliente es atendido en un ambiente aseado y acogedor, razón por la que siempre vuelven a realizar sus compras. Ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Hace cinco años inicio en el negocio con un pequeño capital, el cual invirtió de manera inteligente, cada día es un reto que esperar superar junto a su esposo, quién es su mano derecha y juntos luchan para brindarles a sus hijos, salud y educación de calidad.
Ella solicita el préstamo para aumentar la producción de su negocio, requiere comprar granos básicos, tales como arroz y frijoles; asimismo aceite, condimentos, golosinas, gaseosas, productos lácteos, entre otros. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela incrementar su clientela y al mismo tiempo su negocio, una de sus metas es establecer una miscelánea y así lograr abarcar un mercado más amplio. Otro de sus sueños es establecer una farmacia y brindarle oportunidad a sus primas farmacéuticas, puesto que están desempleadas; definitivamente una mujer carismática y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Everyday before opening the doors to her grocery store, Enyi cleans and arranges all of her products with a lot of pleasure and enthusiasm.  Her customers are tended to in a neat and welcoming environment, which is why they always come back to do their shopping.  She is 40 years old, married and has two children.  Five years ago, she started this business with a small amount of money that she invested intelligently.  Everyday is a challenge that she hopes to overcome with her husband who is her right hand, and together they strive to give their children health and a quality education.

She is seeking this loan to increase the productivity of her business.  She needs to purchase basic grains such as rice and beans, as well as oil, condiments, snacks, soda, dairy products and others.  She is placing her trust in this loan because she hopes to increase her customer base as well as her business.  One of her goals is to open a general store, which will allow her to have a larger market.  Another one of her dreams is to open a pharmacy and provide an opportunity to her cousins who are pharmacists but are currently unemployed.  She is definitely a charismatic and enterprising woman.

loans.use: purchase basic grains such as rice, beans, oil, condiments, snacks, soda, dairy products and others.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, aged 49 years, is a resident of Moiben village in Kenya. He owns a small plot of land on which he has been practising mixed farming for more than 14 years! He grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family expenses. In order to take better care of his family of six children, financially speaking, William needs to significantly increase the quantity of milk he sells from his farm. 

William is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. William is expecting a 20 litre increase in milk production daily with the new cow.  The income generated as a result is enough to repay the loan within the repayment period on time. The additional income will go towards the education of William’s children.

In future, William is going to introduce zero-grazing which he projects will lead to a further increase in milk production. William can’t wait to start making real profits from dairy farming. Currently, his biggest challenge is limited funds. William is thankful for Juhudi Kilimo and its partners like KIVA who are there to support smallholder farmers.

He plans to plough some of the extra money he will make back into the business and purchase better quality cows. He says his family will greatly benefit from the increased income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María tiene 67 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura solo tienen una hija pero ella vive fuera del país, por lo tanto ella y su esposo viven solos.

María y su esposo siempre se han dedicado al trabajo en la agricultura sembrando una hectárea de maíz, María aprendió el trabajo por sus padres, el lugar donde cultiva está a una distancia de 30 minutos caminando desde su casa, otro ingresos que ellos poseen es lo poco que su hija le envía como remesa, su esposo realiza los trabajo fuertes de la agricultura desde las 6:00 AM hasta 12:00 PM.

El crédito será utilizado para cancelar el alquiler de la parcela y para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y cancelar a las personas que trabajaran durante la siembra de maíz.

Su sueño principal que Dios le permita obtener una buena cosecha para cancelar sus compromisos crediticios y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María, 67, studied up to second grade.  She's in a common-law relationship and her husband works in agriculture.  They have only one daughter but she lives abroad, so María and her husband live alone.

María and her husband have always worked in agriculture growing a hectare of corn.  María learned the work from her parents.  The land they cultivate is a 30-minute walk from her house.  Other income they have is the little bit their daughter sends in remittances.  Her husband does the heavy agricultural work from 6 a.m. until 12 noon.

She'll use the loan to pay the rent on her land, buy fertilizer and pesticide, and pay the people who will work during the corn planting.

Her main dream is that God will allow her to have a good harvest so she can pay back her financial commitments and keep on working.

loans.use: to pay the rent on her land, to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas

loans.name: Obaatanpa 2 Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Obaatanpa 2 group, who are from Chorkor-Accra, a city in Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs, who sell plantains, shoes, foodstuffs, banku (cooked corn and cassava paste) and stew, spices and salted fish. This is their second loan from ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva, and they are applying for a loan of GHS 4,700 in total. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Dora is the featured leader of this group. The 71-year-old is widow and a businesswoman. Her children are all grown up and are on their own. Doris has been a businesswoman for eight years, now. She sells dried and salted fish. With her share of this loan, she will buy dried and salted fish wholesale from the seashore and sell it to her customers. 

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy dried and salted fish wholesale from the seashore

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Peter. He is a father of five who lives and farms in Kisii, a rural town in Kenya. Peter and his tribesmen are known for taking bananas as their staple food. Peter has been practising mixed farming for 20 years! His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, bananas and personal business. He is very passionate about farming: “It has been my source of income for all this time!” he exclaimed. 

His biggest challenge is poor roads leading to the market. Because of this, they settle for local markets that offer lower prices. Peter is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow that produces more than 10 litres of milk a day. This is an upgrade from the traditional breeds that are kept for subsistence.

With your loan, Peter is going to shift into commercial dairy farming to improve the living standard of his family. Most of the money will go to his children’s education since that sets the foundation for their future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married Ugandan man with four children; three are in school. He owns rentals in conjunction with a retail shop, not forgetting phone and battery charging from which he generates additional income.

Sustaining his family was the major push for involving himself in the above-mentioned activities. In case he is given a loan, he would like to use it to renovate his rentals. His major dream is to have all his children educated in spite the challenges of competitors and changes in tastes and preferences of his customers.

loans.use: to renovate his rentals.

loans.name: Elisa Delfina

texts.es: Elisa a sus 66 años de edad todavia tienen el animo suficiente para seguir trabajando en su actividad que es la crianza de animales, ella es casada y tien 5 hijos pero ya ninguno vive con ella, Elisa vive con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura, con el credito Elisa va a comprar chanchos y seguir adelante en este y poder ayudar a sus 2 nietas que viven con Elisa y que estan asistiendo al colegio.
texts.en:
Elisa, 66, still has the necessary energy to keep on working in her job raising animals.  She's married and has five children, but none of them live with her anymore.  Elisa lives with her husband, who works in agriculture.

With the loan Elisa's going to buy pigs and get ahead with it. That way she can help her two granddaughters, who live with her and are attending school.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy red-oil and bags of rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli lives in Meghri town. She is a Russian language teacher working in a local school for 15 years already. Her two daughters are married and live separately with their families. 

Leyli also provides individual training for her students at home. She has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase a PC, chairs and a table for providing training to students. Leyli has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help Leyli to provide better conditions for her students.

loans.use: to purchase a PC, chairs and a table for providing training to students

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy winter wear clothes from South Africa.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of coal and cartons of soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seeds to plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toothpaste, flavoring cubes, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Hello, world. Meet Miriam. The mother of five lives on a small piece of land in Kisii, Kenya. Miriam has been involved in farming for more than 18 years! Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, food crops and other personal businesses.

Of all the activity she is involved in, she finds maize farming to be the most enjoyable. The biggest challenge she dreads is animal diseases. This negatively affects productivity. 

Miriam is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow is going to produce more than 10 litres of milk a day for sale. The money is sufficient to repay the loan on time. 

With your lending, Miriam is going to improve the state of her dairy farm and introduce zero-grazing in the future. This will significantly lead to increased productivity and income for her family. 

Miriam sees a brighter future where her family will be leading a life with a better living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tres De Noviembre  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito  Tres de Noviembre está formado por 7 socias quienes viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, por su geografía accidentada tiene hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su centro parroquial es colonial y  moderno. Su gente es amable y muy trabajadora, se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales y al comercio, muchos han migrado en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Ana, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá es empleado privado y su mamá se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en donde vive es propia.
Doña Ana se dedica a la cría de ganado, cuyes y gallinas a las que las vende en su propia comunidad, la leche que obtiene de su ganado vende a los carros lecheros.
 Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado para la cría. Su meta es de tener más animales, como también tener un taller de bordado artesanal.
texts.en:
Tres de Noviembre Group is made up of seven members who live around the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate that has beautiful natural landscapes to enjoy because of the rugged geography.  The parish center is colonial and modern.  The people there are friendly and very hardworking.  They work in agriculture, raising animals, and commerce, and many have migrated in search of a better future for their families.

One of the members of this group is Ana, 24, who is single and lives with her parents.  Her father's a private employee and her mother works in agriculture.  The house she lives in is their own.

Ana earns a living raising livestock, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she sells in her own community.  She sells the milk from her cows to milk trucks.  She's going to invest her new loan in buying livestock to raise.

Her goal is to have more animals as well as a workshop for handmade embroidery.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes.
Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector.
Todos los días trabaja para darle una buena calidad de vida  a su bebe de 3 meses por la cual aspira a darle un excelente futuro.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su actividad.
El guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Jhon is a very friendly person and always has a smile for the customers that visit his grocery store. Thanks to his charisma and good humor he has been able to win the hearts and recognition of the people in his neighborhood. Everyday he works to give his three-month-old baby a good quality of life with the hope of an excellent future.

Currently he is asking for a loan to buy basic goods supplies and in this way provide a significant impulse for his business. He harbors the hope of being able to continue with his business and go on impacting the lives of his customers through his good service.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to supply his business.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank, aged 37 years, is a married Ugandan man without children. Farming is his major occupation, but he also offers motorcycle transportation business services coupled with food crop farming. 

The above two key activities are the ones from which he gets extra income to sustain him and improve on his standard of living. 

He needs a loan to buy beans for selling. 

His future dream is to expand his business and also construct a residential house. He lacks capital to inject into his business.

loans.use: to buy beans for selling.

loans.name: Ncucumo Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Robinah is an old client of UGAFODE's and a member of the Ncucumo Twimukye Group. She is a 56-year-old married woman with ten children, only one of whom attends school. She lives in Ncucumo, Bushenyi district. She sells produce to clients from both rural and urban settings. Right now she is facing challenges of collecting debts from her customers and high prices being charged by her suppliers. 

Robinah has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings to support her business, which she started in 2009 to meet her family's basic needs. She is a hardworking woman who also engages in the coffee trade and banana harvesting to supplement her income. 

Through hard work, she has managed her business and is determined to grow it significantly. She would like to give thanks to all her lenders for the support they provide. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future after getting this loan.

loans.use: to buy produce for her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su familia, en su casa que cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz), en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y comercio de plásticos como utensillos, bolsas de mercado, bandejas entre otros, cuenta con clientes de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales menores como gallinas y patos y una segunda parte la compra de productos de plásticos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana María is 42 years old. She lives with her family in a house with utilities (water and light) in the Buenos Aires district, a community of farming, trading, and raising livestock. It is located in the Morropon Province, part of the Piura Region near the north coast of Peru.

She raises young animals and sells plastic goods like utensils, shopping bags, trays, etc  to customers in the region. She applied for a loan for 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy small animals like chickens and ducks and also to purchase plastic products to offer her clients.

loans.use: to purchase small animals and a variety of plastic products to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Elena es una señora divorciada, Elena vive con sus 4 hijos, una de sus hijos es discapacitada que sufre de un retardo mental y comenta Elena que su hija discapacitada tiene un hijo y que es Elena quien le da cuidando, manteniendo y educando, Elena vende verduras en el mercado de frutas y verduras, y tambien se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para tener un ingreso que le permita seguir manteniendo a sus hijos  queestan estudiando y a su nieta.
texts.en:
Elena is a divorcée who lives with her four children.  One of her daughters is handicapped, and has a mental disability.  This daughter has a son and Elena takes care of him, raises him and educates him.  Elena sells vegetables in the fruit and vegetables market.  She also raises small animals.

The loan she is seeking will be used to purchase pigs to have a source of income that will allow her to continue taking care of her children who are in school and her grandchild.

loans.use: purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, cubes, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for affordable and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es:
Medardo de 57 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y tiene 6 hijos, cuatro ya están en su propio hogar y dos aún dependen de él.

Medardo trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 35 años, lo aprendió cuando trabajaba como jornalero en una hacienda, desde entonces ha dedicado todo su tiempo a trabajar para que a su familia no les haga falta nada.


El crédito que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas para sembrar dos hectáreas  de maíz y así podrá sacar una mejor cosecha y mejores ingresos.

Medardo sueña con mejorar su vivienda, tener 3 vacas de manera que se reproduzcan cada año y aumentar el numero de animales y así no solo depender de la agricultura.
texts.en:
Medardo is 57 years old, and has a sixth grade education.  He is married and has six children.  Four of them are already living in their own homes, and two are still dependent on him.  Medardo has worked in agriculture for the past 35 years.  He learned the trade when he worked as a day laborer on a ranch.  From then on, he has devoted all of his time to working so that his family will never lack anything.

The loan that he is seeking from CREDICAMPO is needed to purchase agricultural supplies to plant two hectares of corn to be able to produce a better harvest and generate more income.  Medardo dreams of improving his home, and having three cows that will breed every year and increase the number of animals so that he does not have to depend only on agriculture.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to plant to hectares of corn.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Aracely, en conjunto con su esposo es comerciante de pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación, de estos ingresos mantiene los gastos básicos del hogar así como la alimentación, Aracely acude a solicitar este crédito para invertir en el negocio con productos que a diario vende como granos básicos, pollo, carne, cereales, repostería, productos enlatados, productos de aseo del hogar y personal así como también un poco de cosméticos, con esta inversión ella pretende mantener surtida la venta para abastecer siempre a su clientela, de esta manera garantizar las ventas.
texts.en: Doña Aracely, along with her husband, is the owner of a grocery store that they run from their home. The earnings help them cover household expenses, like food. Aracely is asking for this loan so she can invest in stocking her store by purchasing items like basic grains, chicken, meat, cereal, pastries, canned goods, toiletries and cosmetics. This investment will help her keep her store stocked for her customers and will guarantee sales.

loans.use: purchasing groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, cubes, salt, pepper, onion, and coal

loans.name: Johnnathan Harold

texts.es:
Johnnathan Harold, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y se ha plantado muchas metas profesionales a largo plazo. Actualmente ha iniciado sus estudios del quinto ciclo de la carrera de Ingeniería Electrónica y telecomunicaciones, lleva dos años estudiando y para terminar le falta aproximadamente tres años y medio, uno de sus grandes sueños es tener su propia empresa y de esa manera agradecer a sus padres que son su mayor apoyo y lograr ser él quien los apoye.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago total de las cuotas del quinto ciclo de su carrera, para así poder estudiar tranquilamente, sin la preocupación de la falta de dinero cuando se vence su cuota y evitar que le restrinjan los exámenes.
texts.en:
Johnnathan Harold is 21 years old, single, and has set many professional goals for the long term. Currently he has begin his fifth semester of classes toward a degree in Electronic and Telecommunication Engineering. He has been studying for two years and he has about three years left before he finishes.

One of his biggest dreams is to have his own business and he is grateful to his parents for being his greatest support and he wants to be the one who supports them.

He will use the loan to cover the total cost of his fifth semester of his degree. This way he will be able to study comfortably with out worrying about a lack of money when his payment comes due and avoid having his exams restricted.

loans.use: to cover all of the payments for the fifth semester of engineering degree classes.

loans.name: José Brígido

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad, su familia está formada por dos hijos y su esposa quienes le ayudan en las actividades diarias que realiza para llevar el sustento a la familia

José se levanta a las 5:00 AM para irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus hijos, y en la tarde trabaja como vigilante de una finca cerca de donde reside.
 
	El crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. cuenta  con la experiencia necesaria de varios años para llegar a obtener una buena cosecha y obtener buenos ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

Sus planes a futuro son comprar ganado y generar producción de leche con ayuda de otro crédito y con la ayuda de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 64 years old. He works in agriculture. He grew up with parents who taught him this activity. His family includes two children and his wife. 

They help him with the daily duties which brings food to the family. José wakes up at 5:00 AM to take himself to the plots where he works with his children in the morning. In the afternoon, he works as a security guard for a ranch near his home. 

The loan he needs will be used to purchase farming supplies like seeds, fertilizers, etc. He has the necessary experience from many years of work to obtain a good harvest and profits for his family's food. 

His plans for the future are to purchase livestock and to start producing milk with the help of another loan and his children.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies like seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a citrus-farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.  Josefina is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to  buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming citrus business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sarnalyn

texts.en:
Sarnalyn is 33 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Sarnalyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 61 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a buy-and-sell root crops business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell.

Feliciana has been in this business for nine years.  In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for affordable and efficient cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Meet Thomas, a father of five from Kisii, Kenya. Thomas has been a mixed farmer for the last twelve years. He makes ends meet by selling milk, eggs and tea produced on his farm. He also engages in other personal businesses to make more money for his family. 

Generating income for the family is his greatest motivator. However, poor roads leading to the market are his biggest challenge. 

He is very passionate about dairy farming. To pull himself out of poverty, he mobilized a group of farmers and got them to join groups. The groups that joined Juhudi Kilimo were trained and introduced to loans. 

Thomas is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He has future plans of introducing zero grazing to improve milk production on his farm. 

With your loan, Thomas will improve the state of his dairy farm. This only serves to generate more money that will go to improving his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for affordable and efficient cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for efficient and affordable cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Ryamuganga Imuka Tukore Group

texts.en:
Lonard is a member of Ryamuganga Imuka Tukore group. He is 46 years old and an old client. He is married with three children aged 6, 9, and 14 years and all attend school. 

He does agriculture, specializing in tea and banana planting. He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX (one million, five hundred thousand shillings only) to buy fertilizer for his tea plantation. He started his business in 1988 with the aim of getting income to support his family. The business is carried out from Ryamuganga a rural area in Mitooma district and his clients are the tea factories and tea business men.  

He hopes to harvest high quality tea through his hard work and become a very rich man in future after utilizing the loan. He is faced with the challenge of poor weather conditions but is determined to increase his productivity through his hard working. He is thankful for the financial support from micro lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nyanyo Kpakpa Group

texts.en:
These women are part of Nyanyo Kpakpo (good friend) group which consists of four people who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. They are selling fish, wigs, and cream. 

The representative for this group is named Doris, who sell wigs, cream, and ornaments. Doris is 39 years old and she is married to a tailor named Osumanu. The couple has four children, all in school, who are their dependents. Doris lives with her ​​husband and children, and handles together with her ​​husband the various family expenditures. 

For the past twenty-nine years Doris has been running a business selling wigs, cream, and ornaments in a kiosk. She buy wigs, cream, and ornaments from the wholesale market and sells them to customers. 

Seeking for customer satisfaction and wanting to increase her turnover, Doris is requesting for the eight time a loan from ID-Ghana. The previously granted loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: To buy wigs, cream, and ornaments from the wholesale market, and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of rice to sell and to buy accessories for his rice husking machine.

loans.name: Olga Mariana

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y vive en el Distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Al ser madre soltera tuvo que buscar la manera de sacar adelante a su pequeña hija. Sin duda alguna es una mujer luchadora cuyo principal objetivo es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña.
Desde hace más de 4 años trabaja como Vendedora en una Imprenta y le va muy bien porque es muy trabajadora, responsable y amable con los clientes.
Olga está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá arreglar el cuarto de su hija (pintarrajear las paredes, comprar nuevas cortinas, comprar una nueva cama) para que de esta manera ella sienta mayor comodidad en su hogar. Con esto Olga seguirá esforzándose en el trabajo para que más adelante pueda cumplir su gran sueño:"Brindarle una carrera Profesional a su hija".
texts.en:
Olga is a hardworking woman; she is 32 years old, is single, and lives in the district of San Juan Lurigancho along with her family. Upon becoming a single mother, she had to look for a way to move her young daughter forward. Without a doubt, she is a fighting woman whose principle objective is to give a better quality of life to her little one.

Since the age of 4, she has worked as a saleswoman in a printing house, and it is going very well because she is very hardworking, responsible, and kind with the clients.

Olga is thankful to the Kiva lenders because, with their help, she can fix her daughter's room (to repair the walls, and to buy curtains and a new bed) so that, in this way, she will feel more comfortable at home. With this, Olga will continue to make an effort at work so that she can realize her big dream: "To offer her daughter a professional career."

loans.use: To improve her daughter's bedroom (to repair the walls, and to buy curtains and a bed).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, a generator, and fabric.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Nancy has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business direct selling herbal products in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal products to sell for her business direct selling herbal products.

Gina has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his children's education

loans.name: Mayra Del Rosario

texts.es: El negocio de doña Mayra es de crianza de marranos y pollos, se dedica a este oficio desde hace más de ocho años. Con sus ganancias ayudo a su esposo ha construir su casa y darle así un mejor lugar para vivir a sus hijos, Agradece a Fape y Kiva por confiar en ella y darle el apoyo ya que tiene más de cuatro años de estar en Fape. Solicita el crédito para la compra de marranos de dos meses, concentrado, afrecho y granillo.
texts.en: Doña Mayra has a business raising pigs and chickens; she has worked in this job for more than eight years. With her earnings, she helped her husband to build their house and therefore give a better life to their sons. She thanks Fape and Kiva for trusting in her and giving her the support; she has now been with Fape for more than four years. She asks for this loan in order to buy two-month-old pigs, pig food, bran, and grains.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig food for them.

loans.name: Dúo Gracias A Dios Ll Group

texts.es:
DUO GRACIAS A DIOS II
La señora Norma Catalina de 21 años, soltera,  desde hace 2 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña Norma es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz  y gas propano para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en:
Norma Catalina is single and 21 years old. For the past 2 years she's had a tortilleria (tortilla shop) located in Chimaltenango. 

Through this achievement she was able improve her home and help her family to get ahead. 

Norma's dream is to improve the quality of her life and her family's through microcredit. 

With this loan she plans buy corn and propane to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane for her tortillería

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and some sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ingris Aracely

texts.es: Ingris, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada, tiene un hijo, y vive con su hijo y esposo en una aldea del municipio de Puerto Cortes. Ella tiene 3 años y medio de haber establecido su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como azúcar, arroz, huevos, medicinas, manteca, frijoles, maíz, carnes, productos de aseo etc. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo a la institución para surtir la pulpería de productos como carnes, granos básicos, productos de aseo, manteca, azúcar, y otros abarrotes, para poder incrementar las ventas y el numero de clientes y prosperar con su familia.
texts.en: Ingris, who is 30 years old, is married. She is married. She has a child and she lives with her son and husband in a village in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. She has owned a corner store for 3 1/2 years and she sells basic necessities like sugar, rice, eggs, medicine, vegetable shortening, beans, corn, meat, hygiene products, etc. She is requesting her second loan from this institution in order to stock her corner store with products like meats, basic grains, hygiene products, vegetable shortening, sugar, and other groceries in order to increase her sales, number of clients, and family's prosperity.

loans.use: to stock her corner store with products like meats, basic grains, hygiene products, vegetable shortening, sugar, and other groceries

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Née en 1971, Afi est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants à Tokoin. Seule à avoir une source de revenu dans son ménage, elle vend des poissons fris  dans son quartier et d’autres quartiers voisins. Afi achète une fois par semaine les poissons au Frigo de Gbossimé et les fait frire elle-même à la maison.
Elle sollicite ce microcrédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de tirer plus de bénéfices  et  s’occuper de sa famille avec les bénéfices.
texts.en: Born in 1971, Afi is married and the mother of four (04) children. She lives in Tokoin.  Afi is the only bread-winner in her family.  She sells fried fish in her neighborhood and in surrounding neighborhoods.  She buys fish on a weekly basis at the Gbossimé frozen food market and fries them herself at home.  She is requesting a micro-loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.  She plans to use her profits to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy two crates of fried fish, one basket of tomatoes and one can of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Noeli Yolibeth

texts.es: Noeli, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo, reside en una aldea del municipio de Puerto Cortes. Hace mas de 3 años que se decidió por tener su propio negocio para generar ingresos, vende ropa, sandalias, tenis, short, camisas y perfumes. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 6,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de ropa, sandalias y perfumes para vender. Ella considera que manteniendo surtido va poder incrementar las ventas y clientes.
texts.en:
Noeli is a 32 year old single mother with one son. She lives in a village in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. 

Over 3 years ago she decided to start her own business to generate revenue. 
She sells clothing, sandals, tennis, shorts, shirts and perfume out of her home. 

She is requesting a loan of 6,000 lempiras and will buy clothes, shoes and perfume to sell. 

She believes that by keeping a variety of products she will be able to increase sales and customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and perfume to sell.

loans.name: Magaly Guadalupe

texts.es: Magaly de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos de los cuales uno de ellos ya es empleado y le ayuda económicamente, ella actualmente posee una tienda que se encuentra ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 4 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su hijo logran salir adelante con los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, Magaly está solicitando un crédito para la inversión de la tienda, comprando golosinas, aceite, granos básicos, refrescos, azúcar, etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Magaly is 40 years old. She lives in her own house with her children. One of them is already working and helps her financially. She has owned a store located in her residence for 4 years. With the money she makes from the sales, and with her son’s help they manage to get ahead with the household expenses.

Magaly is requesting this loan to invest in the store. She is going to buy candy, oil, basic grains, soft drinks, sugar, etc. That way she can keep her job and offer her family a better quality of life without restrictions.

loans.use: to buy candy, oil, basic grains, soft drinks, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Getzemani Group

texts.es: Dúo Getzemani Este dúo es conformado por  doña Felipa de 55  años de edad, sigue manteniendo el negocio de  venta de ropa típica, venta de servilletas,  y elaboración de costura en los cortes típicos del área de San Juan Sacatepéquez, ella  expresa que a Dios gracias siempre mantiene a su clientela buscando de su servicio, es el caso de doña Felipa que por acercarse la feria  titular de este municipio varias señoritas y señoras le  piden güipiles y trajes completos de esta localidad, es por eso que solicita de capital para lograr mantener y mandar a elaborar estas prendas para  que no quede mal con su clientela.
texts.en:
Felipa, 55, is a member of Dúo Getzemani.  She keeps on supporting her business selling traditional clothing and napkins, as well as sewing traditional outfits of the San Juan Sacatepéquez area.  She said that, thanks to God, her customers keep on soliciting her services.  In Felipa's case, at the main town market, several women and young women ordered huipiles [traditional woven blouses] and entire outfits from this town.  

This is why she's requesting capital to be able to keep on having these garments made to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make and sell traditional textiles

loans.name: Leonarda Chana

texts.es:
La socia Leonarda Chana se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Leonarda Chana, keeps working in her grocery store. This member sells basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. This member works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. She is being in this business for 5 years, and everything is going very well. This member’s dream is to expand her grocery store.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. This member is happy for the loan, and she is committed to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana de 48 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado pero eso no la detuvo ya que ella decidió tomar clases de biblia y de esta manera aprendió a leer y escribir, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, el padre de sus hijos los abandona cuando el último aún estaba pequeño, por lo tanto ella tomó toda la responsabilidad de criarlos y enseñarles a trabajar, solamente ellos viven en casa.

Ana es empleada, trabaja como ama de casa una labor que desempeña desde hace mas de 10 años, la necesidad de tener ingresos para el hogar la llevó a tomar la iniciativa de trabajar y de vez en cuando se dedica al comercio.  Es una mujer emprendedora capaz de lograr lo que propone, no tiene más actividades a la cual se dedique, y el trabajo le queda a unos 500 metros de de su casa y se va a pie.


El préstamo será invertido para terminar de construir un cuarto que le está agregando a su casa, la mejora que el préstamo  hará es que Ana pueda terminar la construcción ya que es muy necesario porque la familia es bastante grande.
 
Ella sueña con tener lo necesario para el hogar y que a sus hijos no les falte nada por lo que espera seguir trabajando siempre y cuando Dios le de salud y vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old. She completed only the 4th grade, but that didn’t stop her because she decided to take bible classes and that’s how she learned to read and write. She is a single mother of 4 children. The father abandoned them when the last one was still little, therefore she took all the responsibility to raise them and teach them to work. They’re the only ones living in the house.

Ana is an employee, she works as a housemaid, and she’s being doing this for over 10 years. The need to have a household income helped  her to make the decision to work , and once in a while she works in trading. She is an enterprising woman, able to reach her goals. She doesn’t have any other occupation. Her workplace is 500 meters from her house, and she walks there.

The loan will be invested to finish building a room that she is adding to her house. The loan will help her to finish the construction. It is necessary because the family is very large. She dreams with having the necessary stuff for her home and be able to provide for her children. She hopes she can keep working as soon as God grants her good health and a long life.

loans.use: to finish building a room that she is adding to her house.

loans.name: Martín De Jesús

texts.es:
Martín se dedica a la albañilería, el creció con su padre quien le enseñó esta actividad, su familia solo está conformada  por su esposa quien le apoya en los oficios domésticos ya que sus hijos han formado sus propios hogares.

Martín se levanta a las 6:30 AM para ir a trabajar durante todo el día en construcción y en proyectos en los alrededores de su localidad.  

 
Él necesita el crédito para comprar los materiales como polines, zicalum, pernos, etc que necesita para  cambiar techo de su vivienda ya que el techo filtra agua lo que genera que se le dañen sus pertenencias y no es seguro para su esposa. 

Para un futuro él planea incursionar en la siembra de maíz y con ayuda de otro crédito espera lograrlo.
texts.en:
Martín works in construction.  He grew up with his father, who taught him this work.  His family is made up of just his wife, because their children have made their own homes.  His wife helps him with the household chores.  Martín gets up at 6:30 a.m. to go to work all day in construction and on projects on the outskirts of his town.

He needs the loan to buy supplies he needs to replace the roof of his house: planks, metal sheets, bolts, etc.  The roof leaks water, which damages his belongings and isn't safe for his wife.

In the future he plans to get into growing corn, and he hopes to do that with the help of another loan.

loans.use: to buy planks, metal sheets, bolts, and other materials to replace the roof

loans.name: Tokim

texts.fr:
Née en 1982, elle est mariée et mère de deux(02)enfants à Agoè. Elle est dans la restauration  depuis 2005. Mais elle vend de la bouillie. Elle achète le  maïs et du mil en gros depuis le marché de Bassar situé à 327km de Lomé et prépare la bouillie qu’elle revend  au bord de la route de son quartier. Elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois.
Elle sollicite ce microcrédit pour agrandir son restaurant et ajouter d’autres produits complémentaires afin de satisfaire les clients et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en: Born in 1982, Tokim is married and the mother of two (02) children.  She lives in Agoè.  She has been preparing meals since 2005.  Specifically, Tokim sells cooked cereals.  She buys maize and millet in bulk quantities at the Bassar market located 327 kilometers away from Lomé.  She prepares her dishes and resells them on the side of the road, in her neighborhood.  She buys her supplies twice a month.  Tokim is requesting this micro-loan to expand her food preparation business, and to diversify her activity by adding other products.  Her goal is to satisfy the needs of her customers and to increase her turnover.

loans.use: to buy three bags of millet and two bags of maize.

loans.name: Marlenth Audely

texts.es:
Marlenth tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, ella está soltera y vive con su madre, pero ya se quiere independizar.


Ella vende en un chalet con la junto con su madre desde hace 12 años, el lugar esá ubicado en la misma ciudad donde vive y solo tiene que caminar 6 cuadras para llegar, y termina de trabajar a las 9 de la noche, esto lo aprendió de su madre ya que siempre ha sido un ejemplo para ella. 


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 14 metros de cerámica, 14 bolsas de pegamix para pegar la cerámica y también pondrá la energía eléctrica en el cuarto que está construyendo, también comprará 3 metros d arena.  

Ella planea a futuro, casarse tener dos hijos, y es por eso que quiere estar aparte desde ya para irse independizando.
texts.en:
Marleth, 28 has a high school degree.  She is single and lives with her mother, but she wants to become independent.

She has been selling from a shop with her mother for 12 years.  The shop is located in the same city where she lives, and she only has to walk 6 blocks to get there.  She works until 9 at night.  She learned this trade from her mother, who has always been an example for her.

Marleth needs a loan to buy 14 meters of tile and 14 sacks of adhesive for the tile.  She will also install electricity in the room that she is building.  She will also buy 3 meters of sand.

For the future, Marleth plans to marry and have 2 children.  This is why she wants to be on her own so that she can become independent.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a room that she is building

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro and his family raise sheep in Western Mexico State and are looking to better benefit from the potential energy and fertilizer produced every single day by their animals. 

With his eight cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Pedro will process sheep manure into renewable, methane-rich biogas, allowing him to displace the propane he currently uses to cook and heat bathwater. The digestion process will also create a potent soil amendment helping Pedro improve crop yields without having to invest more money in fossil-fuel based agrochemical fertilizers. 

This will allow Pedro to be more independent while concurrently saving money and helping the environment. This loan represents 48% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and affordable cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and clean cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, se decidió por otro crédito para continuar mejorando su negocio y teniendo ingresos que necesita para subsistir junto a su familia, le servirá para comprar aceite, harina, aderezos, tomates, repollo, quesillo, chicharrón, bebidas y gas propano.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a Juana a tener un negocio con los materiales necesarios para seguir elaborando la venta de pupusas, gracias a la demanda de sus productos ella hace una jornada más de trabajo por las tardes en su casa.
texts.en:
Juana decided to get another loan to keep improving her business and keep having the income she needs to survive with her family. She’ll use it to buy oil, flour, seasoning, tomatoes, cabbage, fresh cheese, fried pork rind, drinks, and propane gas.

The previous loan helped Juana to have a business with the necessary materials to keep making and selling pupusas [stuffed griddle corn cakes] . Thanks to the high demand of her products, she works one more sheet in the afternoons at her house.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour, seasoning, tomatoes, cabbage, fresh cheese, fried pork rind, drinks, and propane gas.

loans.name: Virgilio De Jesús

texts.es:
Virgilio de 38 años, se dedica a la albañilería y la agricultura, él creció con su padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividades, su familia está conformada  por su esposa quien le apoya en las actividades diarias y su hijo que es un pequeño de 5 años.

Virgilio se levanta a las 6:30 AM para ir a trabajar durante toda la mañana en construcción a los alrededores de su localidad o afuera de ella, y cuando llega la temporada agrícola se dedica  a ambas actividades.  

 
	El crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. que necesita para la siembra  ya que cuenta  con la experiencia necesaria de varios años para llegar a obtener una buena cosecha 

Sus planes a futuro son tener ganado de ordeño y con ayuda de otro crédito podrá obtener un mejor ingreso para el sustento de su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 38-years old.  He makes his living as a bricklayer and in agriculture.  He grew up with his parents, who taught him both businesses.  His family is made up of himself, his wife, who helps him with his daily activities, and their young son, who is 5-years old. 

Virgilio gets up at 6:30 am to go to work.  He works all morning in construction projects around his neighborhood or outside the area.  When the farming season arrives, he does both activities. 
 
Virgilio need the loan to purchase agricultural supplies like poison, seeds, compost etc., that he needs for planting.  He has many years experience to help him get a good harvest. 

Virgilio's future plans are to have milk-producing livestock.  With the help of another loan, he will be able to increase his income to support his wife and son.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like poison, seeds, compost etc., which he needs for planting.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en: Dahiru remembers the starvation his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Dahiru, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Dahiru is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. Dahiru's ambition does not stop there; “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Dahiru. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality farming inputs

loans.name: Julio César

texts.en:
Born in Mexico but raised in the US, Julio César has a vision. He wants to see sustainability become a principle on the small family farms with which he is so familiar. 

Julio César even built his own, smaller biodigester to put the concept into practice; in short, he has big ideas and he follows through on them. He is investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to scale up. He was already producing his own biogas and fertilizer and is now going for a larger system, allowing him to produce more renewable biogas and rich biofertilizer from the animal waste on his farm. 

He also plans on using his system to demonstrate the technology in the region, imploring more of his fellow farmers to adopt more sustainable and cost-saving practices. This loan represents 90% of the total cost of Julio's Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Moises Enrique

texts.en: Moíses Enrique is a young, enthusiastic farmer passionate about nature and tending to his fields. He truly loves the land and his desire to improve his farming practices is infectious. He is investing in a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to reduce his farm's environmental impact while concurrently generating economic savings through fertilizer and energy production. Using his newly-installed biodigester, he will convert animal waste into potent, methane-rich biogas, allowing him to displace fossil-fuel based propane in cooking and heating bathwater. The digester will also produce potent biofertilizer, helping Moíses Enrique improve crop yields without having to spend on expensive agrochemical fertilizer. This loan represents 47% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Maribel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing cages like fishing net, bamboo, etc., for her fishing business.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing cages like fishing net, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine, and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña Rosa María se dedica a la crianza de marranos y pollos, Ella dice que con sus ganancias ayuda a sus hijos a comprarle los útiles para que vayan a la escuela, es una señora joven y quiere darle lo mejor a sus hijos. Con el crédito comprara marranos, concentrado y vitaminas. Sus marranos los vende en el mercado de la localidad. Agradece a Fape y Kiva el apoyo que le han brindado para salir adelante.
texts.en: Doña Rosa María makes her living raising pigs and chickens.  She says that with her earnings, she helps to buy her children school supplies so they can go to school.  Doña Rosa María is a young woman who wants to give her children the best.  She will purchase pigs, animal feed and vitamins with the loan.  She sells her pigs in the local market.  Doña Rosa María is grateful to Fape and Kiva for the help they have provided so she can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru:
Эту жительницу города Душанбе зовут Рахима. Ей 37 лет. Год назад Рахима вместе с мужем стала заниматься торговым бизнесом. Они занимаются продажей продуктов питания. Их магазин расположен прямо на рынке, где всегда многолюдно. Из-за удачного расположения магазина, товар в их магазине долго не стоит, а наоборот быстро расходится. Рахима решила расширить бизнес и за счет кредита увеличить ассортимент товара в магазине.  
У Рахимы с мужем двое сыновей. Они хотят дать своим сыновьям хорошее образование и поэтому трудятся усердно для их светлого будущего. Они надеются, что их просьба о финансовой помощи для развития бизнеса найдет поддержку.
texts.en:
This is Rahima, an inhabitant of  the city of Dushanbe.   She is 37 years old. A year ago she and her husband decided to go into retail business. They sell  groceries. Their store is located right at the market, where there are always crowds. Thanks to the good location of their store, their goods do not remain on the shelves for the long time, but get sold out quickly. Rahima decide to expand her business and increase the selection of goods in her store thanks to her loan.

Rahima and her husband have two sons. They would like to ensure that their sons get a good education, and they work very hard for a better future for their children. They hope that their request for financial support to develop their business will be granted.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Amor Group

texts.es: los socios del grupo”ESPERANZA Y AMOR” estan dedicados al comercio minorista. Carlos es un joven de 31 años de edad soltero dedicado a la venta de miel y café actividad que aprendio  de sus padres. El credito lo invertira en la compra de mas miel y café para expenderlos a sus familiares vecinos y al publico. El grupo  agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el credito brinado. Carlos es el cuarto del lado izquierdo viste polo cuello camisero celeste .
texts.en:
The members of the "Esperanza y Amor" group all make their livings in retail.

Carlos is a young 31-year-old man who is single and makes a living selling honey and coffee. He learned this occupations from his parents. He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of honey and coffee to sell to family, neighbors, and the public.

The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan offered. Carlos is the fourth form the left wearing a light blue polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy more honey and coffee.

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Donata dreams of being financially free so that she will be able to help more needy persons. She also hopes for her children to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Santiago De Jesús

texts.es:
Santiago de 47 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pues él era el mayor de 5 hermanos y tenía que ayudarles a sus padres a trabajar, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón, tiene 4 hijos pero ya están casados por lo tanto solo Santiago y su esposa viven en casa.



Santiago siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, además compra ganado para sacar ganancias, se traslada en bicicleta 5 kilómetros para poder llegar hasta donde tiene su parcela.



El dinero del préstamo será invertido para comprar un novillo, pues quiere tener una yunta de bueyes.



Los sueños de Santiago son poder salir adelante con su trabajo, tener ganado de repasto y tener una vivienda digna donde pueda vivir junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Santiago is 47 years old. He did not have the opportunity to go to school as he was the oldest of 5 children and he had to help his parents by working. He is married and his wife makes a living selling cashew nuts. He has four children but they are all married so Santiago and his wife live alone in their home.

Santiago has always made a living working in agriculture. He learned this occupation from his parents. He also buy livestock to make a profit. He rides his bicycle five kilometers to get to where his plot of land is.

He will use the money from this loan to invest in the purchase of a young steer because he wants to have a pair of yoked steers. Santiago's dreams are to be able to get ahead in his work, have breeding cattle and have a dignified home where he can live together with his wife.

loans.use: to buy a young steer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, and a gate for her home.

loans.name: Jhon Raymundo

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre trabajador, con muchos deseos de superación, tiene 40 años, es soltero, y vive en Nazca junto a su familia.
Estudió la carrera de Informática y actualmente está estudiando un Diplomado porque quiere crecer profesionalmente. Desde hace varios años trabaja en el Hospital de la zona donde vive, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, siempre dedicado al trabajo para poder obtener resultados favorables.
Jhon está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar su  cuarto como pintarrajear las paredes y comprarse un juego de dormitorio para que pueda descansar tranquilo. De esta manera seguirá esforzándose para poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Obtener su Título Universitario".
texts.en:
Jhon is a hardworking man with a lot of desire to improve himself. He is 40 years old, single, and lives in Nazca near his family. He studied a degree program in computer science and currently he is studying a certificate program because he wants to grow professionally. For many years he has worked at the hospital in the area where he lives. It is going very well for him because he is a very responsible person, always dedicated to work in order to obtain favorable results. 

Jhon is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given him he will be able to remodel his room like plaster the walls and buy himself a set of furniture so he can rest calmly.  In this way he will continue applying himself in order to achieve his great dream: “To obtain his university degree.”

loans.use: to improve his room for greater comfort.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 32 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, coffee, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Raquel has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Raquel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, coffee, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Jesus

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven trabajador, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el Distrito de Santiago junto a su familia. Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de comida como ceviche, chilcano y todos los platos con pescados y mariscos, le va muy bien en el negocio porque es una persona muy responsable, emprendedora, y sobre todo porque sus platillos son excelentes, muy deliciosos y de excelente calidad y a un buen precio.
Cesar está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos para preparar sus platos y con esto incrementará los pedidos y obtendrá mayores ingresos que podrá utilizarlo para estudiar una Carrera Profesional.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young worker. He is 20 years old, single, and lives in the Santiago district together with his family. For several years he has made a living selling food like ceviche, chilcano [a Peruvian fish soup], and all dishes with fish and seafood. The business is going very well for him because he is a very responsible, entrepreneurial person, but above all because his dishes are excellent, very delicious, of excellent quality and at a good price.

Cesar is grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the help offered he will buy ingredients to prepare his dishes. With this he will increase his demand and make a better income which he can use to study for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy buy ingredients to use in his business seafood business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet owns and operates a food stall. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her small variety store.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 17,000 to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities.

Juliet hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings

loans.name: Johnamay

texts.en:
Johnamay is 53 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, bread, etc.

Johnamay has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and farming rice.

Johnamay aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 45 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Amalia has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Amalia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María Gloria tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el Caserío de Cruz Verde, una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de “chicha de jora”, una bebida que se prepara a base del maíz amarillo y que es heredada desde el tiempo de los Incas, también vende comida, cuenta con clientela de la zona, junto con su esposo se dedican a la crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un artefacto (congeladora) que le permitirá tener un buenas condiciones los alimentos que compra para la preparación de sus preparos.
texts.en:
María Gloria is 38 years old and lives with her husband and sun in the neighborhood of Cruz Verde. It is a rural area in the district of La Matanza, a community where there is farming, trade, and livestock. It is located in the Morropon province that belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling chicha de jora, which is a drink made from a yellow corn base and is inherited from the time of the Inca. She also sells food and she has a customer base in the area. She and her husband raise small livestock in the back of their home.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy an appliance (a refrigerator) that will allow her to have better storage for the food she buys for her prep.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator that will allow her to have better food storage.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 29 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, soap, shampoo, spices, etc.

Dina has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Dina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, soap, shampoo, spices, etc

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Florinda works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Florinda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Florinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 56 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and general store.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Rhea Mae

texts.en:
As a parent of five children, Rhea Mae works hard to support her family.

She has a fish dealer business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rhea Mae is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes to sell for her fish dealer business.

Rhea Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 27 years old, married with three children between the ages of six and one and a half years old, and one of his children currently attends school.  Julius saved money from farming and started a produce store buying and selling primarily maize and nuts. 

Bad roads hinder his business as they limit delivery of goods to his customers.  
Julius is acquiring credit to buy maize for sell.  He hopes to build a residential house in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of banana to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 8 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of banana to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana has a small business selling clothing at the local market. She lives with her husband and two children in a small private house. There are two windows that need to  be changed - in the kitchen and in the bath room. Diana wants to put new windows that will not just look better but save energy (mostly during the heating season) which is very relevant with the new prices for natural gas in Ukraine. She also will make some remodeling in the bath room - put new tiles, new toilet and bathtub - to improve sanitary conditions for her family. Diana is asking for a loan of 15,000 gryvnas which she intends to pay back from from her business income.

loans.use: to put new energy saving windows and remodel bath room

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: For more than eleven years, Vladimir has been selling women's shoes at the market. In the summer, he sells sandals and shoes, in the winter, he sells boots. Vladimir often travels with the shoes to nearby villages, offering his merchandise to those who live there. These trips to meet customers give him a competitive advantage and increase his turnover. Vladimir has requested to receive a loan of 20,000 hryvnia in order to purchase high demand items especially for village customers. This will allow Vladimir to better serve the needs of his customers and increase turnover. Vladimir is married. His wife helps him with his business. His children are already grown. He dreams of making enough money to help them obtain their own housing.

loans.use: to purchase high demand models of shoes for village customers

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent lives in Hoima, Uganda.  He is twenty-four years old, married with one child aged one and a half years. He deals in buying and selling warangi (a distilled beverage) and that business is supplemented by income from his farming and taxi (transport) business.

Limited capital is a hindrance to his business.  He is accessing credit to buy more waragi to sell.
His dream is to build a commercial house to increase his sources of revenue.

loans.use: to buy more waragi to sell.

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya works as a secretary/cashier. She is not married and lives with her parents in a house. The house is old and need remodelling. Olesya decided to help her parent remodel the house. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 hryvnias that are needed to remodel the bathroom. This will be a good start in remodeling the whole house.
Olesya is a volonteer in a Christian children ministry helping many kids to learn and apply healthy family and human values.

loans.use: to fix the bath room at her parents house
